1
一
one
One down, 2041 to go. ;)
Show on Jisho
2
二
two
two lines
Show on Jisho
3
三
three
one + two = three.
Show on Jisho
4
四
four
FOUR year-olds often put their FOOT (human legs) in their MOUTH - but they are too young to realize.

5
五
five
三 + two vertical lines = 5

6
六
six
Indicating 6 parts of the human body: head, body, 2 arms, 2 legs

七
seven
This kanji is our good old seven, turned upside down.

八
eight
The volcano hasn't erupted for 8 years

九
nine
It looks like an elaborate letter "n" for nine.

十
ten
Two needles crossing marks the spot, or you can use the Roman character for ten (rotated 45 degrees).

口
mouth
Looks like a huge open mouth

day

目_目.

Don't look at the sun directly with your eyes, it's risky!

companion
My companion and I are like two moons side by side. Mun and Minmus

bright

chant
Someone chanting with their mouth open for two consecutive days.

sparkle
A diamond sparkles as brightly as three suns.

goods
*Three boxes* of goods are devoured by the hungry *mouths* of waiting consumers.

spine
spine connects head and body

prosperous
If you work from Sun UP to Sun DOWN you will be prosperous.

early
EARLY, is when you have to start your *day* before *10*..

*Nine planets* revolve around our rising sun.

世
generation

胃
stomach
The *rice field* is harvested once a *month* to get food for our stomach
Show on Jisho
30
旦
nightbreak
The sun is nightbreak(ing) on the floor. (The sun is break dancing)
Show on Jisho
31
胆
gall bladder
All the *month* long I have to start working at *nightbreak*. This really activates my gall bladder (=I get angry)
Show on Jisho
32
亘
span
The span of the day is the time between the sun goes up and comes down
Show on Jisho
33
凹
concave
Concave has a concave shape Stroke order: I took a step down into the cave. A park ranger threw down a line to me from the opposite top ridge, then waited. My friend went down to the lowest passage to look for me, then the ranger threw another line down to her.
Show on Jisho
34
凸
convex
Convex has a convex shape Stroke order: think of questing forward, then climbing a huge vertical stroke, only to take an easy step down. (Remember the three segments of the step down are one stroke. There is no such equivalent for the step up, so you have to take it segment by segment.) The bottom is just like mouth.
Show on Jisho
35
旧
olden times
Age 18 = olden times
Show on Jisho
36
自
oneself
To use an eyedropper by oneself, aim from *above* to put a *drop* into the *eye*.
Show on Jisho
37
白
white
Even a small drop (') of the sun (日) would make you see nothing but white.
Show on Jisho
38
百
hundred
That dirty ceiling was painted WHITE a hundred times!
Show on Jisho
39
中
in
I use chopsticks to put food in my mouth.
Show on Jisho
40
千
thousand
It takes many drops of ten to get to a thousand.
Show on Jisho
41
舌
tongue
What is in a *mouth* that permits it to speak a *thousand* things? Yes, a #tongue#.
Show on Jisho
42
升
measuring box
A measuring box is a square wooden box that was used to measure one thousand grains of rice (needles) in feudal Japan. It was supposed to be enough to feed a working man for one day.
Show on Jisho
43
昇
rise up
This kanji does not mean "get up" or "awake." It means rising, like the rising of a salary, or a promotion. STORY: You know that your salary has RISEN UP when your MEASURING BOX has enough dollar bills in it to reach the SUN.
Show on Jisho
44
丸
round
Cut the tail off of a 9 and it will be round.
Show on Jisho
45
寸
measurement
Glue two sticks together to make the best measurement. (I always remember the primitive, but never the original keyword.)
Show on Jisho
46
肘
elbow
The elbow is the *flesh* that *glues* together the upper and lower arm.
Show on Jisho
47
専
specialty
10 brains glued together allows you to specialize in any specialty that you want. Imagine each brain having its own specialty
Show on Jisho
48
博
Dr.
Note: Use #Ph.D.# rather than #Dr.# to avoid confusion with #doctor# and to be more in line with common use of this kanji. *Ten* *specialities* grants you the title of #Ph.D.# with a *dot*.
Show on Jisho

eminent
The most eminent magician is he who learned to use his *magic wand early* in life.

If *morning* breath emanates from your *mouth*, you are subject to derision!

只
only
Imagine an animal with only a *mouth* and *leg*s.

貝

Remove the *eyes* and the *legs*, and a shellfish tastes great!

唄
pop song
The new generation of #pop songs# have no depth. They just *mouth* empty lyrics to get *money*. Not like the #pop songs# of my day.

貞
upright
A *magic wand* is needed to make a *clam* stand upright.
Show on Jisho

員
employee
An employee (#member# of the company) has to clam up his mouth if he wants keep the job!
Show on Jisho
60
貼
post a bill(stick)
Fortune teller writes your fortune on a piece of paper and tells you to affix it to a shell and throw into the ocean for it to come true. Picture licking the back of the shell like a stamp and affixing it to the fortune.

61
見
see
Eyes and legs are all you need to see the world.

In the *olden times*, a newborn babe came out *leg*s first.

元
beginning
In the beginning were just *two* who walked on *human legs*

page
*One* *drop* of ink from a *shellfish* can fill a whole page.
Show on Jisho

頑
stubborn
A stubborn person in the *beginning* gets something into their *head* and can't change their mind.

凡
mediocre
A *drop* of breeze is naught but a mediocre *wind*

負
defeat
*Tied up*, the *shellfish* had to accept defeat!
Show on Jisho
68
万
ten thousand
I *bound* ten thousand dollars together and hid it under the *floor*.
Show on Jisho
69
句
phrase
Some Japanese #phrase#s are difficult to *wrap* your *mouth* around.
Show on Jisho
70
肌
texture
When you expose your *flesh* to the *wind* it gets #textured#: goosebumps!
Show on Jisho
71
旬
decameron
#Hint:# *Here's info from Wikipedia regarding why this kanji exists, which helped me remember it:* [Japan also divides the month roughly into three 10-day periods. Each is called a jun (旬). The first is jōjun (上旬); the second, chūjun (中旬); the last, gejun (下旬). These are frequently used to indicate approximate times, for example, "the temperatures are typical of the jōjun of April"; "a vote on a bill is expected during the gejun of this month."]
Show on Jisho
72
勺
ladle
A ladle binds drops together.
Show on Jisho
73
的
bull's eye
I managed to hit the bull's eye by throwing my white ladle.

neck
When I think of a neck, I think of a giraffe. This kanji is just a pictograph of giraffe's face, with those little *horns* on top and a big *nose*.

This is a fish hook, that pulls out the fishguts

79
真
true
It's true that I got a needle stuck in my eye once. Luckily, we had a tool to pull the needle out from my eye. True story.

craft
I-beams are used to CRAFT skyscrapers.

The LEFT *side* of my brain *posesses* the faculties needed for logical *crafts*, like engineering

Samurai carry two swords on their belt: a curved katana and a straighter, shorter wakizashi.

The part of a *sword* where a *drop of blood* can usually be found is the blade.

The sun was shining so bright that it seduced Icarus and he flew too close.

When you have both *money* and the power of the *sword*, you can make the #rules#.

The *wealthy* guy with the *sword* standing next to the king, that's the vice-roy who does all the dirty work.
Show on Jisho

別
separate
I don't know about you but to me this seems like someone's head is about to be separated from his body. You can see he's kneeling and his mouth is wide open gasping for the last breath he will ever take.

95
丁
street
Today, the program "Sesame Street" is brought to you by the letter "T"
Show on Jisho
96
町
village(small town)
Getting this one confused with Town is easy, so remember it with this rhyme. "Pillage the village, for the *rice* and and the *tea*." the street primitive on the right looks like a 't'.
Show on Jisho
97
可
can
A mouth on the street asking for things: "Can I get some help?! Can I get directions, Can I have some money? Can you please speak English?!"
Show on Jisho
98
頂
place on the head
If I put a *street sign* on my *head* what do I get ? A place on the head !
Show on Jisho
99
子
child
A pictograph of a child, with arms outstretched for mother (or perhaps because she is chasing a rat?). Note that this kanji occupies the first space on the Zodiac circle, and is the sign for the rat (such as 2008!).
Show on Jisho
100
孔
cavity
When a child falls into a cavity we need a hook to get them out. The child's arms flailed around at the sight of the hooked tool the dentist was going to use to fill his cavity.

101
了
complete
The experiment was a complete failure! The child was made without any arms!

woman
My mother taught me that a woman should always sit with her legs crossed (but the arms can be stretched out).

好
fond
A *woman* is fond of her *child*

如
likeness
*Women* share a common likeness. Their *mouth*s are always open, whining about this and that.

mama
This mama had twins, one *mouth* for each *nipple*.

The pac man's (只) elder brother has to have longer legs than his junior.

Caution: this means a spell, not to swear. I put a curse on my *elder brother* so that he can never open his *mouth*.

115
汐
eventide
Eventide is when the drops of water are attracted to the moon. This is the tide which occurs in the evening.
Show on Jisho
116
外
outside
A young magician likes to practice outside in the *evening* with his *magic wand* (as opposed to the old magician who wakes *early* to practice with his *wand* in {卓}).
Show on Jisho
117
名
name
In the evening, when it becomes dark, open your mouth to say your name so that people can recognise you.
Show on Jisho
118
石
stone
Indiana Jones jumps up and grabs the lip of *cliff* just in time to evade the huge STONE rolling out of the *mouth* of the cave!
Show on Jisho
119
肖
resemblance
This kanji bears a resemblance to sparks on a candle. (I always remember the primitive, but never the original keyword.)
Show on Jisho
120
硝
nitrate
That stone resembles nitrate. Salpetre is the common name for Nitrate coming from Latin "sal petrae" or stone salt. It is also a component of gun powder so including a candle in this kanji can be quite explosive!
Show on Jisho
121
砕
smash
To SMASH a STONE you need to hit it NINE or TEN times.
Show on Jisho
122
砂
sand
Over time, *rocks* are worn down into just a *few* grains of sand.
Show on Jisho
123
妬
jealous
The jealous *woman* bashed the brains in of the guy who betrayed her, with a *stone*.
Show on Jisho
124
削
plane
Not "*a #plane#"*, but *"to #plane#"*. To carve a sculpture from wooden block, you cut it (with a *sword*) little by little, until there is *resemblance* with whatever it was meant to *resemble*.
Show on Jisho
125
光
ray
In the *beginning* (when there were little stars ) there was a *little* ray of light in the universe
Show on Jisho
126
太
plump
A big person sits, tries to reach a cd but he can't reach it because he is #plump#
Show on Jisho
127
器
utensil
Imagine four hungry *mouths* all sitting around the table. They are all banging their #utensils# on the table waiting for a *big* meal to be placed in the centre.
Show on Jisho
128
臭
stinking
The ST. BERNARD DOG lifted his large NOSE high in the air to find out where the stinking smell comes from.

嗅

Your mouth stinks: you need to sniff your breath.

妙
exquisite
exquisite *women* are *few* and far between.

131
省
focus
You focus by concentrating your *eye* on *few*er objects.

thick
The #thick# *cliff* walls protected the *children* from the *sun*
Show on Jisho

奇

Imagine a ST. BERNARD DOG carrying a CAN instead of a barrel in rescue missions. How strange!
Show on Jisho
134
川
stream
There are *three* default I/O #Streams# in UNIX, stdin, stdout, and stderr.
Show on Jisho
135
州
state
There were 3 little islands in the *stream* who all decided to set themselves up as independent #states#.
Show on Jisho
136
順
obey
"Obey, Obey!" says the brain-washing scientist as he sends a *stream* of orders to fill your *head*.
Show on Jisho
137
水
water
The kanji for water is an abstract primitive itself, so unless one is willing to break down its etymological development, it should just simply be memorized by strokes; constructing a story is not necessarily useful unless it strongly denotes its shape (I find that Heisig's story doesn't do this).
Show on Jisho
138
氷
icicle
Icicles start with 1 frozen *drop* of *water*
Show on Jisho
139
永
eternity
It would take an eternity to count all the drops of water unless it's on a mini floor
Show on Jisho
140
泉
spring
*White* is a symbol of purety, so *white* *water* is pure water, the precise definition of spring water.
Show on Jisho
141
腺
gland
a *body part* that acts like a *spring* for hormones is a gland
Show on Jisho
142
原
meadow
Follow the *springs* down the *cliff* and you will find a nice meadow.
Show on Jisho
143
願
petition
Let's petition to save that beautiful MEADOW from overdevelopment by signing on this PAGE.
Show on Jisho
144
泳
swim
If you don't know how to swim, you'll be in that *water* for *eternity*
Show on Jisho
145
沼
marsh
The marshlands near Mordor seduce Frodo into gazing upon them, and he falls into the water--splash!
Show on Jisho
146
沖
open sea
Open sea is a lot of water in the middle of nowhere.
Show on Jisho
147
汎
pan-
This is pan- as in the prefix meaning "all". I think of Pangea as being a mediocre continent with water covering the rest of the planet. This was before it broke up into the first-class, well-distributed continents we got now.
Show on Jisho
148
江
creek
A CREEK is a small trail of *water* easily *craft*ed with a stick.
Show on Jisho
149
汰
cleanse(selection)
I couldn't find any reference to this kanji as meaning cleanse. It seems to be most often used in the following compound 沙汰（さた）to mean affair. The other meanings seem to be closer to 'select' so maybe Heisig meant cleanse in the ethnic sense here.. I'm going to use the keyword "selection", as in natural selection. Story: natural selection first began in the water, and those that were too plump were selected out.
Show on Jisho
150
汁
soup
To make soup you just take *water* and *add* (+) the rest of your ingredients. Water and ten ingredients can become a good soup!
Show on Jisho
151
沙
grains of sand
To keep this separated from {117}: *Water* erodes away stone a *few* grains of sand at a time until there is no stone left.
Show on Jisho
152
潮
tide
The morning tide is basically, well, WATER in the MORNING.
Show on Jisho
153
源
source
The *water* that flows from the *meadow* is the #source# of life for the wild antelope
Show on Jisho
154
活
lively
This keyword makes me think of animals. I picture a big dog running through the grass, saliva dripping from his tongue.
Show on Jisho
155
消
extinguish
To extinguish a SPARK, you need WATER.
Show on Jisho
156
況
but of course
If you ask your *teenager* if what he's drinking is *water* (and not Vodka), he will answer "but of course".
Show on Jisho
157
河
river
A river CAN exist only if there is WATER.
Show on Jisho
158
泊
overnight
Please supply a guest who stays overnight with WATER and WHITE sheets.
Show on Jisho
159
湖
lake
This is my favorite story. Simply associate the sad moment of an OLD person, standing near the WATER of the lake and looking at the MOON reflected in the lake. The created primitives themselves are put so beautifully, that you will not forget this kanji.
Show on Jisho
160
測
fathom
A *fathom* is the unit you use when making #rules# about #water#'s depth.
Show on Jisho
161
土
soil
Remembering soil is easy. If soil is soft, you can take a *walking stick* and plunge it two* feet into the ground.
Show on Jisho
162
吐
spit
SPIT goes from my MOUTH to the GROUND.
Show on Jisho
163
圧
pressure
The GROUND at the base of a CLIFF must suffer from enormous pressure.
Show on Jisho
164
埼
cape
A CAPE is a piece of LAND that stands out STRANGELY in the sea. (think of a cape *DIRT*y)
Show on Jisho
165
垣
hedge
Before the Great Wall of China, there was a dirt hedge that spanned across.
Show on Jisho
166
填
inlay(fill in)
In a hole in the *ground*, the body of the victim was placed. And then the killer #stuffed it up# so that the *truth* would not be found out, he hoped.
Show on Jisho
167
圭
squared jewel
Piling *SOIL* upon *SOIL* for aeons is how SQUARE JEWELS are formed deep in the earth.
Show on Jisho
168
封
seal
The king used a special seal of ivy leaves glued onto his document.
Show on Jisho
169
涯
horizon
Try to reverse Heisig's story in this Kanji: imagine being trapped in one of those prison towers on an ivy cladcliff like in the movies. From your prison ontop the ivy clad cliff all you can see in the distant horizon is nothing but water.
Show on Jisho
170
寺
Buddhist temple
At the Buddhist temple the monks are seated on the *ground*, *glued* there in meditation.
Show on Jisho
171
時
time
When the SUN starts to shine on the TEMPLE, it's time to get up.
Show on Jisho
172
均
level
*Soil* is scooped up into a *ladel*. The extra *drop* is brushed off to make it level.
Show on Jisho
173
火
fire
For some reason, this kanji reminds me of a person running, her arms (the two drops) raised up, because she caught on fire!
Show on Jisho
174
炎
inflammation
If you have an INFLAMMATION, it feels like there's *fire* above and below your skin.
Show on Jisho
175
煩
anxiety
An anxiety feels like FIRE in the HEAD.
Show on Jisho
176
淡
thin
Drink *water* and *burn twice* as many calories as you eat... you'll definitely get thin. Imagine inside your body, all those calories literally being *burned* from above and below... THAT's what it takes to become thin.
Show on Jisho
177
灯
lamp
Imagine old gas lamps which had a *flame* to light up the *street signs*.
Show on Jisho
178
畑
farm
Many farms are created by first setting FIRE over the land to clear the land for the FIELDS.
Show on Jisho
179
災
disaster
What a disaster! A FIRE, then on top of it came FLOODs.
Show on Jisho
180
灰
ashes
The *fire* underneath the *cliff* will eventually turn everything above to ashes.
Show on Jisho
181
点
spot
The FORTUNE TELLER was burned by FLAMES on the spot because she was accused of being a witch.
Show on Jisho
182
照
illuminate
SHINING FLAMES illuminate!
Show on Jisho
183
魚
fish
The elements of this kanji are bound up, rice field and cooking fire. When I think of bound up cooked rice, it makes me think of sushi, which in turn brings to mind fish.
Show on Jisho
184
漁
fishing
"FISHING For Idiots", Chapter One: *Fish* are generally found in *water*.
Show on Jisho
185
里
ri
It's not just any computer. It's an old Ata#ri#. The ri is a Japanese way of measuring the area of the GROUND underneath a RICE FIELD.
Show on Jisho
186
黒
black
*Burning* a *computer* is *ri*-diculous. It just leaves everything all BLACK.
Show on Jisho
187
墨
black ink
Theres BLACK on the GROUND...most likely someone spilt some black ink.
Show on Jisho
188
鯉
carp
pesce-computer. Una #CARPA#
Show on Jisho
189
量
quantity
I did such a quantity of work that when NIGHT BREAK came, I was asleep on the COMPUTER. A quantity can be a measure of time or space (day/ri).
Show on Jisho
190
厘
rin
I threw my Rindows *computer* off a *cliff* because it kept crashing. Now, after its last crash, it's worth less than a rin.
Show on Jisho
191
埋
bury
you can`t bury computers underground, because of the dangerous heavy metals, so you hide them behind an equally large mound of soil and hope no-one notices.
Show on Jisho
192
同
same
Muslim women wearing veils (HOOD) all look the same, you can just see ONE MOUTH and very little else.
Show on Jisho
193
洞
den
All the animals in the den share the *same* *water*
Show on Jisho
194
胴
trunk
Dead *flesh* all looks the *same* when you chop off everything but the trunk. Yes, I'm appalled at how gruesome this story is too.
Show on Jisho
195
向
yonder
The spaceman died screaming, his *MOUTH* wide open because someone has cut the oxygen cable from the *HOOD/HELMET* of his space suit. As his last *DROPs* of oxygen escaped into the vastness of space he thought to himself, So much for flying off into the wild blue *YONDER*
Show on Jisho
196
尚
esteem
An especially esteemed alien has three antennae on his helmet.
Show on Jisho
197
字
character
CHILDren learn Kanji characters underneath a HOUSE.
Show on Jisho
198
守
guard
A GUARD is usually "glued" to the house he watches.
Show on Jisho
199
完
perfect
In the beginning, Adam and Eve had a home in Eden. It was perfect.
Show on Jisho
200
宣
proclaim
You can proclaim your opinions from the comfort of your HOUSE and have it SPAN the entire globe these days via The Internet.
Show on Jisho
201
宵
wee hours
I burn the CANDLE in my HOUSE until the WEE HOURS reviewing the kanji!!!
Show on Jisho
202
安
relax/cheap
It's funny, Hesig gives no Kanji in his book that means cheap/inexpensive... well... if you were wondering what Kanji would carry that meaning, look no further. Sometimes I wonder if Hesig just thinks our little brains would be too easily confused by multiple meanings. Regardless, think of that woman relaxing. Cheapest place to do that is in one's own home rather than at some fancy resort, eh? 家で休暇を取るは安いですね。 the CHEAPest place to RELAX with a Woman is At Home
Show on Jisho
203
宴
banquet
The WOMAN spent all DAY preparing a banquet in the HOUSE.
Show on Jisho
204
寄
draw near
The *strange house* has a sign saying "DRAW NEAR" in its window, instead of a 'Beware' sign. It must be a trick!
Show on Jisho
205
富
wealth
Remember Ducktales? That rich duck had that room in his house where he kept all the wealth! He had so much in that house you could even swim in it!
Show on Jisho
206
貯
savings
It takes a lot more than one *clam* of savings to buy a *house* on a *street*.
Show on Jisho
207
木
tree
Pictograph of a tree.
Show on Jisho
208
林
grove
[ #grove# = *tree* + *tree* ] - a #grove# is between a single tree {木} and a many-treed forest {森}
Show on Jisho
209
森
forest
The higher you go up a mountain the less trees there are, that's so u dont mess up with their possition like i do
Show on Jisho
210
桂
Japanese Judas-tree
Simple mnemonic : "The Japanese Judas-tree is the *tree* on which Judas hang himself to the *ivy*" (Judas the traitor of the Christian bible). Just picture Judas hanging himself, using *ivy* as a if it was a rope.
Show on Jisho
211
柏
oak
The wood from oak *trees* can be used to make barrels in which *white* wine is aged. What's more, I love *white* wine with an #oaky# flavour...
Show on Jisho
212
枠
frame
A good *wood*en frame has perfect right angles at each corner: *ninety* degrees at each one.
Show on Jisho
213
梢
treetops
At Christmas time, on the treetops, people used to place great big *candles* (Now we usually place a star instead)
Show on Jisho
214
棚
shelf
A shelf is a *wooden companion* to books.
Show on Jisho
215
杏
apricot
From the *tree* straight into the *mouth* is the best way to eat an apricot!
Show on Jisho
216
桐
paulownia
In Japan, a paulownia (きり）is known as the "princess tree". It was once a traditional TREE planted at the SAME time as the birth of a daughter. It would grow fast enough that, at the time of her wedding, it could be used to make a dresser as a wedding present for her.
Show on Jisho
217
植
plant
Plants don't become *tree*s *straightaway*.
Show on Jisho
218
椅
chair
To the Japanese, the first time they saw a chair, it looked like a *strange* use of *wood*! Probably why they still like to sit on the floor...
Show on Jisho
219
枯
wither
A tree withers away as it gets old.
Show on Jisho
220
朴
crude
*Wooden wands* are the crudest. They are nothing compared to their carbon fibre equivilents.
Show on Jisho
221
村
village
A village is just a bunch of wood glued together. There is a mix up, this kanji means むら=village, not town. The one for town is まち　= 町. 100% shure because my teacher is native Japanese.
Show on Jisho
222
相
inter-
A piece of wood went "inter" my eye. This is an internal injury. The Minister of trees has a good eye for inter-action.
Show on Jisho
223
机
desk
The tree was blown down by the wind, so I made a desk from it. My wooden desk is so messy, it looks like a strong wind blew my things all over it.
Show on Jisho
224
本
book
a book is one slice of a tree
Show on Jisho
225
札
tag
Botanists like to identify a tree by hooking tag on it.
Show on Jisho
226
暦
calendar
Years-Months-Days: It takes many years for a *cliff* to form or erode. A *tree* takes many months to grow. But *days* pass by regularly - so in this way, we see the movement of time such as with a CALENDAR.
Show on Jisho
227
案
plan
Man's plan of life: build a house, find a woman, plant a tree I plan to RELAX on top of that TREE.
Show on Jisho
228
燥
parch
A fire's heat will parch/dry out any goods made from wood. Tip: goods + wood/tree : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it's worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest "furniture" (a common type of wooden goods). REF: parch (FRAME 215) , 操 (#724), 繰 (#1469), 藻 (#2191). Story: It's been so parched recently that your furniture suddenly catches fire.
Show on Jisho
229
未
not yet
The tree is not yet fully grown. I believe a better version of that by mameha1977: [Cheat] Remember these as a set: The tree (木) does not yet (未) have exremities (末) of vermilion (朱).
Show on Jisho
230
末
extremity
The tree has reached the extremity of its growth and no longer produces small, new branches at the top. Instead the existing top branch just grows longer and longer. Another version of that by mameha1977 and dat5h: [Cheat] Remember these as a set: The tree (木) has not yet (未) reached the extremity (末) of its vermilion (朱) foliage.
Show on Jisho
231
昧
obscure
Something that is obscure has *not yet* been brought before the light of *day*. 'Can't you go outside and get some sun?' 'Not yet, I have to learn all these obscure RTK3 kanji!'
Show on Jisho
232
沫
splash
The extremity of a wave of water is the splash.
Show on Jisho
233
味
flavor
My mouth is not yet ready to taste the flavor of a tree. My mouth has not yet swallowed the food because the flavor is so delicious that I keep chewing it.
Show on Jisho
234
妹
younger sister
Younger sister, you'll be a woman soon. But not yet.
Show on Jisho
235
朱
vermilion
It's autumn: only one vermilion leaf on the tree has not yet fallen.
Show on Jisho
236
株
stocks
Which *tree* would you buy stocks in - the healthy one on the left, or the one with only one *vermilion* leaf left on the right?
Show on Jisho
237
若
young
Young single women in Hawaii wear a *flower* over their *right* ear signifying they are available. Wakai.
Show on Jisho
238
草
grass
Grass grows in *earlier* than *flowers*
Show on Jisho
239
苦
suffering
*Flowers* #suffer# when they grow *old*. Trees slowly wither(枯) and die. I find I can remember these together. Flowers for the old man suffering in the hospital.
Show on Jisho
240
苛
bullying
The *Little Engine that Could*, drawing from his own experiences, has become a spokesman against bullying. He visits schools with the slogan "Bullying CAN be stopped," and hands out *flowers* of peace and understanding. "How many flowers can I stuff in your nostrils? Well I'm just gonna have to go and see." Bullying at its worst!
Show on Jisho

寛
tolerant
A tolerant person will ignore *seeing* *flower* (marijuana) in the *house* of a friend.

A *Dr.* missing his needle can only use dilute *flower water* for medicine.

On top of the #leaves# a *flower* appears, promising new *generations* for the old *tree* below

If I find out this furniture you're selling me is made of imitation *wood*, I'll put you in the *graveyard*.

The precise locations of sailors who meet a *watery* *grave* are vague. GRAND LINE pirate's grave

膜
membrane
The membranes in your flesh rot when placed in the graveyard. In the moonlight of the graveyard I hear a zombie say, MMMMM..EMM...BRANEsssss.
Show on Jisho
249
苗
seedling
If you plant seedlings in a *field* eventually they will *flower*.
Show on Jisho
250
兆
portent
The actual derivation of this Kanji is a pictograph of the cracks on a heated *turtle* shell which was used in divination. The way the cracks occur on this *turtle* are a portent of evil bad luck.
Show on Jisho
251
桃
peach tree
King Koopa consistently captures Princess Peach. Eventually he's going to run out of castles and just set her in a tree.
Show on Jisho
252
眺
stare
You lost a #staring# contest with a *turtle* because you blinked your *eye* before he did. (The contest wasn't fair, because turtles have nictitating membranes, and don't need to blink so often.) *Eye* comes first, because stare is most associated with eyes. And compare with {658} where this same obstreperous turtle *challenges* you to a finger wrestling contest.
Show on Jisho
253
犬
dog
A *large* dog, dripping drool.
Show on Jisho
254
状
status quo
After beating the hare in a race, the *turtle* is now acknowledged to be the fastest animal. But the chihuahua is challenging the status quo, demanding a new race. And look - the dog is on the right, meaning he's passed the turtle! Hope he doesn't take a nap.
Show on Jisho
255
黙
silence
The *computer* won't stop beeping, which is making the *chihauhua* bark, and it's driving this guy insane. The only solution he can come up with is to throw them both on the *fire* and finally enjoy the silence.
Show on Jisho
256
然
sort of thing
*Flesh* of a *dog* over a cooking fire = "hotdog". There are all sorts of things in *hot dogs*. Believe me, you don't want to know what sort of things . Visualize the hotdog curling as it cooks, to remember the unusual way the flesh primitive curves in this kanji.
Show on Jisho
257
荻
reed
Reeds are the only *flowers* that *wild dogs* like to *fire* up and smoke while they are playing poker.
Show on Jisho
258
狩
hunt
Actually when hunting it may be a good idea to use a *pack of dogs* as your personal *guard*.
Show on Jisho
259
猫
cat
A *pack of wild dog* scientists formulate a way to grow cats from *seedlings* so their prey is right there on their front lawn. The cat hid in the FLOWERS of the FIELD from the WILD DOGs.
Show on Jisho
260
牛
cow
A cow tried to climb up a vermilion tree, but in doing so, it broke its two bottom branches off.
Show on Jisho
261
特
special
Think of not special people, but special animals. The sacred Hindu *cows* are special - they can wander around the *temple* without fear of becoming roast beef.

告

The revelation makes the cow's mouth drop down, "Hamburgers are made of what?!"

before
I've never seen a *cow* with *human legs* before!
Show on Jisho
264
洗
wash
In Japan, you always wash with *water* from the shower *before* you enter the bathtub.
Show on Jisho
265
介
jammed in
Two people jammed in under an #umbrella#. A woman with a dress and a man (straight). It's always me that ends up getting wet.... but the tail of the skirt is this time! The two strokes at the bottom look like a J and I, which stands for "jammed in."
Show on Jisho
266
界
world
One Japanese farmer I know is so small minded that he thinks the entire world is jammed in the borders of his little rice field.
Show on Jisho
267
茶
tea
Some people think drinking tea is boring and quaint. That's why I spice mine up by adding a cocktail umbrella, which of course is made from a *wood*-en toothpick supporting a paper *umbrella* with *flowers* printed on top.
Show on Jisho
268
脊
spinal column
"Look", says the teacher in biology class. "The spinal column holds your *flesh* together, just like the metal rod of this *umbrella* (he demonstrates this with an umbrella covered in *I-Ching* symbols) holds the umbrella together".
Show on Jisho

合
fit
I wouldn't mind a *meeting* of *mouths* with her, she's really fit !

Usually pearls are white, or black. Only a very rare, very expensive pearl is *vermillion* colored. Such a #pearl# would be fit for a *king*.

Hey, I want my money back! This crystal *ball* is out of order, I can *see* the present instead of the future!

The *ball* was the only thing that people at the *beginning* of time had to use as a toy. Poor cavemen.

Show on Jisho

注
pour
Visualize an idiot trying to figure out how to extinguish a candle. He sees a glass of *water* and decides to pour it onto the *candlestick* to put it out. Water spills everywhere.
Show on Jisho
286
柱
pillar
The main pillar in a house should be made of the biggest and strongest *tree* - the *lord* of the *trees*.
Show on Jisho
287
金
gold
The fat *king* taking up the *whole* space under the *umbrella* actually isn't fat - he just has two big gold bars hidden under his clothes.
Show on Jisho
288
銑
pig iron
Pig-iron is basic/crude *metal*, that is, *before* it has been processed.
Show on Jisho
289
鉢

This is the bowl of an alchemist: see how he mixes *metals* in his bowl, as he follows the instructions from his *book*?
Show on Jisho
290
銅
copper
I can't believe no one has used this one yet: Copper is *metal* which looks almost *the same* as *gold*. Really, look it up on Wikipedia, it's yellow and it's shiny (atleast in some compounds)!
Show on Jisho
291
釣
angling
The easiest angling is pulling *gold*fish out with a big *ladle*.

292
針
needle
Needles need to be metal (or they'll break).
Show on Jisho
293
銘
inscription
A piece of *metal* with a *name* on it. Well, this is basically the definition of inscription.
Show on Jisho
294
鎮
tranquillize
Tranquilize - using a *metal* syringe to get the *truth*.
Show on Jisho
295
道
road-way
When we go out on the road-way, we often risk our own *necks*

導

For guidance on the *road-way*, *glue* a GPS unit to your car.

辻
crossing
crossing a *cross-road*
Show on Jisho

迅
swift
The car went too swiftly through the *crossing* and was *hooked* by the cops on the *road*.

造
create
The cow had the *revelation*: "hamburgers are made of WHAT? Now the cow is on *road* to create an alternative.

迫
urge
He had the sudden urge to eat *white* chocolate in his *way* home.

A *turtle* on the *road-way* wants to escape

辺

To separate the environs, create the border by placing *daggers* on the *road*.
Show on Jisho
303
巡
patrol
The cops don't patrol anymore - they just *flood* the *road*.
Show on Jisho
304
車
car
This one is quite simple, it looks like a car from above, with the frame, axis and big big wheels.
Show on Jisho
305
連
take along
When you put your *car* on the *road* you should always take along a few friends.
Show on Jisho
306
軌
rut
My *car* got so stuck in a rut it required *a baseball team* pushing to get it out again.
Show on Jisho
307
輸
transport
I'm in my *car*, transporting my uncle to a butcher's *meeting*. It should be interesting, they are actually going to cut *flesh* with *sabers*!
Show on Jisho
308
喩
metaphor
#Metaphor#: (Let this altered butcher primitive = *koo-koo butcher*, notice the kana くく). *Koo-koo butcher*s sell even the *mouth* of an animal and support their actions with crappy #metaphors# such as "I ain't never meat the man who doesn't like his mouth."
Show on Jisho
309
前
in front
In front of the *butcher* shop, there is a sign made of *horns*
Show on Jisho
310
煎
roast
In many asian restaurants, meat is roasted right *in front* of you over *flames*.
Show on Jisho
311
各
each
Each person is gifted with a *mouth* to get us into trouble and a pair of *walking legs* to get us out!
Show on Jisho
312
格
status
"Ranger! I want you to go check the status of *each* *tree*." "Errr, *Each* *tree* sir?" replies the ranger looking out over the vast forest. "That's Right, I want the status of *each* *tree*! Move out!"
Show on Jisho
313
賂
graft
When I was caught by the police doing some graft (graffiti), I gave *each* cop some *clams* and told them to be on their way. 賄賂【わいろ】 bribe
Show on Jisho
314
略
abbreviation
There are so many abbreviations and acronyms nowadays that no *brain* can remember *each* of them. Mnemonic: ab-brain-each-ation
Show on Jisho
315
客
guest
*Each* person under my *roof* is treated as a guest.
Show on Jisho
316
額
forehead
The *guest* took a *page* out of book and used it to wipe her sweaty forehead? How impudent!
Show on Jisho
317
夏
summer
I personally think it was too confusing to try and use *head* as the primitive. (How am I supposed to remember that the *animal legs* are replaced with *walking legs* instead of *human legs*?) Rather, I think have the image of a hot summer and you want to keep *oneself* under a *ceiling* not out *jogging* around.
Show on Jisho
318
処
dispose
To dispose rubbish you should walk using *walking legs* to the bin not throw it to the *wind*.
Show on Jisho
319
条
twig
huge giant *walking legs* can break *tree* like a twig!!
Show on Jisho
320
落
fall
When *flower* petals fall, they float gently in the breeze; when *water* falls, it splats and splashes. To *each* thing its own way of falling!
Show on Jisho
321
冗
superfluous
The king's *crown* was blown off by the *wind*. "Oh well," he said, "it's just a superfluous symbol."
Show on Jisho
322
冥
Hades
The beast of #hades# one *day* will wear a *crown*, and the number of the beast is *666*.
Show on Jisho
323
軍
army
The *crowned* *vehicle* depicted here is a “chariot,” symbol of an army.
Show on Jisho
324
輝
radiance
When I think of radiance I think of the greek god Zeus - picture him throwing rays of lightning (hence the extra jaggedness of the character) from atop his chariot riding through the heavens.
Show on Jisho
325
運
carry
Don’t confuse it with “take along” (287). In that one, there was a car so you could take along your friends once you found them on the *road*. In this one, there is an army *chariot* just to carry military supplies (sorry no room for you).
Show on Jisho
326
冠
crown
Remember the superfluous *crown* that flew away in the wind? Well now the king is saying "i should have had the thing *glued* to my head from the *beginning*".
Show on Jisho
327
夢
dream
To have a dream after going to bed is really the *crown* to a perfect *evening*. The *flower* petals over the *eyes* (instead of the “sand” that Westerners are used to finding there when they awake in the morning) only confirms the image of a pleasant dream suggested by the rest of this rather complex kanji.
Show on Jisho
328
坑
pit
A *whirlwind* digs a hole in the ground throwing out lots of *dirt* until it ends up with a giant pit.
Show on Jisho
329
高
tall
Here we have two *mouths* each wearing a different hat. The top one is wearing a *top hat* which is know to be as a tall hat. The bottom one is wearing a *space helmet* which is known as an expensive hat. (this kanji means both)
Show on Jisho
330
享
receive
In basketball however, *tall children* receive all the attention.
Show on Jisho
331
塾
cram school
Welcome to our cram school: you will *receive* a *rounded* education on our *grounds*.
Show on Jisho
332
熟
mellow
Imagine *tall children* sitting *round* the *fire* toasting marsh-#mellow#.
Show on Jisho
333
亭
pavilion
The *tall*est Pavilion(like a tent) *crowns* the *street*
Show on Jisho
334
京
capital
Tokyo, capital of Japan: *tall* buildings, *small* people (compared to the buildings).
Show on Jisho
335
涼
refreshing
When you're a tourist in the *capital* during the heat of summer, finding a *water* fountain is oh, so refreshing.
Show on Jisho
336
景
scenery
Anyone who's been to Kyoto doesn't need to think too deeply into this Kanji! Imagine a *sunny* day in the old *capital*, and there's no better scenery.
Show on Jisho
337
鯨
whale
If *fish* were cities, the whale would surely be the *capital*. When the whale was first discovered it was the biggest fish people had ever seen. Stories exaggerated its size - people said it was as big as the entire capital city!
Show on Jisho
338
舎
cottage
The cottage is so small - it has an *umbrella* for the roof; *soil* for the floor and room for only one *mouth*.
Show on Jisho
339
周
circumference
When the *ground* has an *opening* (a hole), you need to cover the entire circumference or you will fall in.
Show on Jisho
340
週
week
Imagine a *road-way* built so well that it takes only a week to travel the *circumference* of the earth.
Show on Jisho
341
士
gentleman
What a handsome gentleman. Standing up so straight, and broad shoulders too!! He's like a modern samurai!
Show on Jisho
342
吉
good luck
A true samurai gentleman will always mouth, "#good luck#" to his opponents before a match.
Show on Jisho
343
壮
robust
The Teenage Mutant Ninja *Turtles* are robust *gentlemen* aren't they?
Show on Jisho
344
荘
villa
A villa is fancier (decorated with *flowers*) and more *robust* than the average.
Show on Jisho
345
売
sell
The *samurai* happened to find an extra large *crown* that he wore as a belt on his waist, just above his *legs*. I wonder if he will sell it to me?
Show on Jisho
346
学
study
Children in schoolhouses are there to study, nothing else!!!
Show on Jisho
347
覚
memorize
You'll never memorize all the kanji by seeing them in a school house. You need Heisig and RtK!
Show on Jisho
348
栄
flourish
The tree flourish in the classroom, a little too much perhaps, there's no room for the students any more.
Show on Jisho
349
書
write
Make sure you practice writing kanji with a brush every day before the sun goes down.
Show on Jisho
350
津
haven
The haven for a brush is in water.. Otherwise they get dry and withered and cant be used?!
Show on Jisho
351
牧
breed
Imagine a *taskmaster* giving a *cow* the command to "start #breed#ing, and start doing it now!", except that the cow takes his advice a bit too literally and starts chasing the taskmaster to carry out this command! instead of finding another cow to breed with. Hence, you see the *taskmaster* running to the right, trying to stay ahead of the *cow*.
Show on Jisho

攻
aggression
If the *task master* hits you with an *I-beam*... I'd say that's aggression!

he failed to produce enough *clams* to please the *taskmaster* (don't confuse with {63})

This *taskmaster* is the bathroom nazi: he counts how many #sheets of# toilet paper and tissue you use, and then tells you what % of a tree you just killed.

Only an old taskmaster uses a stupid word like "happenstance" (coincidence) instead of the many less pretentious synonyms for luck or chance.

Hitler's *flowery phrases* held the nation in awe.

In the Harry Potter world, obituary's are magical. If you wave your wand over them you can hear the person's last words. Creepy!

I said some bad *words*, and my mother chastised me by washing my mouth out with *glue* instead of soap!

Listen carefully to the *words* of instruction before you try swimming in the *river*.

The mnemonic "words to seduce the masses" was just too vague and I kept forgetting it. So now instead I picture a seductive female reading aloud the imperial edict to the masses, thus "seducing" the masses.

packed
*Words* of *good luck* are *packed* into fortune cookies.

Tales are always spoken, not written, and because of this, *words* fly out of your *tongue*, rather than your pen.

410
走
run
Hint: This kanji is NOT *soil* on top of *mend*, as Heisig claims - that would duplicate one of the strokes. Instead, it is *10* on top of *mend*. So my story is: If you run *10* miles, you will need to *mend* your socks!

Get a visual image of the blueprints all rolled up like they usually are. The second step is easy, it's just the architecht stretching out the blueprints and showing it to his clients.

Show on Jisho
444
帯
sash
Heisig fails to go into detail about the top kanji, but, It's not a mountain like everyone is saying. It actually means *Thirty* 丗 the stroke order starts with a *One*, then draw in the three vertical lines from left to right. Then the last stroke at the bottom closing it up. Then comes the *Apron* which makes up a Sash. (-Story: I made a Sash out of *Thirty* cut up *Aprons*.
Show on Jisho
445
滞
stagnate
History of the first karate blackbelts: In those days, it was often difficult to find fresh, clean *water*, so samurai usually had to wash their *sashes* in #stagnant# puddles. The longer one had been studying martial arts, the older the sash on one's karate uniform and, therefore, the darker the color. So why weren't their karate uniforms black too? Never seen a ninja????
Show on Jisho

The tree was covered with a *belt* of thorns. They cut like a *sabre*!

492
葛
kudzu
#Kudzu# is a *flowering* plant that never takes a *siesta*...it grows constantly and has already overtaken most of the southeastern United States. Beware the kudzu! Flower, siesta: The muchacho was not careful. He passed the warning signs and decided to hold a siesta in the kudzu field. The kudzu grew so fast, he was completely covered by it in a few hours and not able to escape. Now, the kudzu flowers mark his grave.

Show on Jisho
499
梅
plum
#Plums# actually grow on every single tree. What, you didn't know that? They do. Orange trees, apple trees, cantaloupe trees. Plums are simply mutant fruits that have been installed in the root software of every single tree. I hear that some plum-loving scientists are working on a way to hack *every* *tree's* genetic code so that *every tree* will bear nothing _but_ plums.
Show on Jisho

Show on Jisho
507
炊
cook
Japanese cooking sometimes *lacks* *fire*, e.g., sashimi.
Show on Jisho
508
歌
song
#Can-Can#-ers #lack# the ability to sing a #song#, so they just dance
Show on Jisho
509
軟
soft
Cars are rough steel things, lacking softness.
Show on Jisho
510
次
next
Is this store *lack*ing *ice*? Let's try the next one, then.
Show on Jisho
511
茨
briar
To prevent animals from eating the beautiful flowers in your garden, the best thing to do is to plant briar bushes immediately *next* to them.
Show on Jisho
512
資
assets
The first SHELLS you get you obviously spend, but the NEXT SHELLS are your ASSETS, you should bury them in a low safe place (placement!)
Show on Jisho
513
姿
figure
The next woman always has a better figure! Thinking like that, you'll end up alone in an old folks home longing for the good old days!
Show on Jisho
514
諮
consult with
Don't like the *words* of the first one? Consult with the *next mouth* available.
Show on Jisho
515
賠
compensation
Compensation is money you give to someone to shut them up (i.e. muzzle their mouth).
Show on Jisho
516
培
cultivate
To cultivate the *land* is to tame it, control it. In short, you *muzzle* it's unruly, chaotic nature. 培う つちかう to cultivate, to foster; 栽培 (さいばい) : cultivation
Show on Jisho
517
剖
divide
When you DIVIDE someone, there is sure to be a lot of screaming. That's why you should use a MUZZLE before using the SABER.
Show on Jisho
518
音
sound
The *tongue wagging in a mouth* produces a very high-pitched #sound#, breaking a nearby *vase*.
Show on Jisho
519
暗
darkness
In places of complete #darkness#, such as caves where the *sun* can't reach, creatures such as bats have learned to navigate by *sound* rather than sight. The poor guys must have to fly around screaming "Marco!" and "Polo!" all the time.
Show on Jisho
520
韻
rhyme
A rhyme is the *sound* of an *employee* going off to work. Everyone knows that ever since 'Snow White' in 1937 all employees sing 'hi ho, hi ho, it's off to work I go' (because it's so catchy! And it's so catchy because 'ho' rhymes with 'go'!).
Show on Jisho
521
識
discriminating
*Words* are difficult to discriminate/discern from *sounds* in the middle of a *fiesta*.
Show on Jisho
522
鏡
mirror
The *metal* mirror makes a *sound* - it's answering the question "who has the fairest *human legs* of all?"
Show on Jisho
523
境
boundary
In the dense cities of Japan even a small garden is a luxury. In this house, the owner has put *mirrors* on the boundary of his *land* so it feels much bigger.
Show on Jisho
524
亡
deceased
The *top hat* hanging on a *hook* belonged to the now deceased Charlie Chaplin.
Show on Jisho
525
盲
blind
A person with *deceased* *eyes* is blind.
Show on Jisho
526
妄
delusion
I had a problem with remembering that "deceased" went over the "woman". So, here's my story: The delusional woman was carrying her deceased husband on her back.
Show on Jisho
527
荒
laid waste
#Laying waste# is just a euphamism for flushing poop down the toilet. It smells nothing like *flowers*, more like *deceased flowers*, and it's flushed down into a *stream* of sewage. Use "waste" to avoid {365} {400}
Show on Jisho
528
望
ambition
The #ambitions# of *kings* often result in *dead* *bodies*.
Show on Jisho
529
方
direction
Note: The primitives are *top hat* and *bound up*. Compare {64}. Story: A rich man wearing a *top hat* and *bound up* from head to toe hobbles up to you and asks for #directions# to the nearest police station because he just escaped from his kidnappers.
Show on Jisho
530
妨
disturb
One way to Disturb a woman is to give her directions while she is in the middle of driving -- she just can't take that kind of stress.
Show on Jisho
531
坊
boy
Little boys always head in the direction of mud and dirt
Show on Jisho
532
芳
perfumed
She used a perfume so strong, that you can track her by following the *direction* of the smell of *flowers*.
Show on Jisho
533
肪
obese
"*Flesh* in all *directions*" = obese
Show on Jisho
534
訪
call on
Japanese streets usually don't have names, so finding places can be difficult. So if you plan to call on someone you need two things; 1) *words* (for asking the way) and 2) a *compass* (in case you get really lost).
Show on Jisho
535
放
set free
Go in any *direction* away from your *taskmaster* when you are #set free#.
Show on Jisho

激
violent
When the *taskmaster* found his favorite *white compas* damaged by *water*, he became the most violent *taskmaster* there ever was.
Show on Jisho
537
脱
undress
"Undress your *flesh*," ordered the devil.
Show on Jisho
538
説
explanation,rumor
The *words* of a *horny teenager* typically fall into one of two categories: either #rumors# or explanations.
Show on Jisho
539
鋭
pointed
Pointed *gold* is the *devil*'s weapon. After all, the love of money is the root of all kinds of evil.
Show on Jisho
540
曽
formerly
Formerly, *horned* animals were used to plough the *ricefield*, and it took all *day*. Nowadays it's done by machine.
Show on Jisho
541
増
increase
Farmers work the #land# so they can INCREASE their #formerly# puny crop supply.
Show on Jisho

presents
SEA SHELLS were FORMALLY great PRESENTS. Nowadays kids wants playstation and DS and TV!
Show on Jisho
543
東
east
Through the *tree*s, I watch the *sun* rising from the east.
Show on Jisho
544
棟
ridgepole
Feng Shui states that the ridgepole of a house should be made of *wood* and face *east*.
Show on Jisho
545
凍
frozen
*Eastern* Siberia is often frozen by *ice*. According to wikipedia, Yakutia (in Eastern Siberia) holds the record as the coldest town on Earth. Check it out yourself...it made it stick for me!
Show on Jisho
546
妊
pregnancy
A woman in pregnancy is a porter of her child.
Show on Jisho
547
廷
courts
In court they STRETCHED the PORTER on the rack until he confessed. Torture!!!
Show on Jisho
548
染
dye
[dye; color; paint; stain; print] The most common #dye#s are *liquids* that come in *nine* colors (the 7 of the rainbow, plus white and black), and are extracted from *trees*.
Show on Jisho
549
燃
burn
*Fire* burns any *sort of thing*.
Show on Jisho
550
賓

This *house* is reserved to V.I.P. only. If you are not *one of the few* with enough *money* to call you that way, keep out!
Show on Jisho
551
歳
year-end
Santa had to put his *foot* down to stop a *march* of *little* guys, namely elves. They were protesting the harsh treatment they get every year-end when Santa asks them to step up toy production for the holiday season.
Show on Jisho
552
県
prefecture
After sticking a *fishhook* in your *eye*, the yakuza boss probably has *little* more to do to convince you to move to a different prefecture.
Show on Jisho
553
栃
horse chestnut
There is a horse chestnut *tree* that has grown by a *cliff* for so long, it has deposited *10,000* #horse chesnut#s that lie at the bottom. Don't worry over this one too much, you'll spend so much time trying to figure out the right story for it, you probably won't forget it.
Show on Jisho
554
地
ground
Picture the ground as an extent of* soil* where* scorpions* are buried like land mines. Imagine a sign post saying 'no trespassing, *scorpion* mines' if that helps, and how it is dangerous to walk there.
Show on Jisho
555
池
pond
Remember the story of the *scorpion* that begged the turtle for a ride across the pond? Halfway across the *water*, the *scorpion* stung the turtle on the neck and they both sank to the bottom.
Show on Jisho

虫
insect
Insect in one drop of amber. Think Jurassic Park.

Bugs have to go to school to learn how to become #lightning bugs#. Only the brightest bugs graduate to become #lightning bugs#.
Show on Jisho

蛇

A snake eats *insects* and he does that outside, while we eat in the *house* and preferably with a *spoon*.
Show on Jisho
559
虹
rainbow
Little is it known that a rainbow is actually created by *insects* of different colours flying in formation, a *craft* they have perfected to create the rainbows we see today.
Show on Jisho
560
蝶
butterfly
A butterfly is an insect that appears after spending a generation on a tree as a cocoon.

I'm telling you, *A pack of wild dogs* were taken down by a SINGLE *insect*!!! Shocking, I know.

There are no *insects* in *heaven* - well, that is, except for #silkworm#s. What, do you expect Jesus to import his fancy robes from China?

風
wind
They say that when an INSECT flaps its wings even the single DROP of WIND that it creates is sometimes enough to create a hurricane on the other side of the Earth.
Show on Jisho
564
己
self
This kanji looks like the "s" of "self", looking at its own reflection in a mirror (reversed sideways), as if pondering about his "self".

Be careful when you`re RUNNING through the jungle, because you might step on and ROUSE a sleeping SNAKE. Then you`ll have to RUN like hell before it bites you!

記
scribe
#Snakes# have no hands. So, when a #snake# needs to write down something, it has to call in a #SCRIBE#, who will write down all the #say#ings of the #snake#.

包
wrap
The *snake* *bound up* its prey by #wrapping# his body around it.

573
亀

It seems bizarre, but tortoises are a genetic cross with the head of a fish and the tail of an eel. Where the shell comes from, no one knows.

電

When it RAINS , if you put an electric EEL in the swimming pool , you can generate ELECTRICITY.

竜

have you ever seen an asian DRAGON? it looks like an eel, but can stand up because it has legs.
Show on Jisho

滝

A *dragon* is so hugh, it uses a waterfall to take a *shower*.
Show on Jisho
577
豚
pork
When a mother pig nurses its piglets, we call it a SOW. When that same mother pig's *body parts* are on our plates, we call them PORK.
Show on Jisho
578
逐
pursue
In association with {540}, our *sow* is on the road #pursuing# a mate.
Show on Jisho
579
遂
consummate
In association with {539}, our *sow* has tracked down a suitable mate, they've consummated their relationship, and now the *little sow* is all grown up into a *boar* with horns.
Show on Jisho
580
家
house
Think of "The Three Little Pigs". There was a *house* made of straw, another made of sticks, and a third made of bricks, each occupied by a *pig*. So, naturally, *housetop* over *pig* means house, the central element of that story.
Show on Jisho
581
嫁
marry into
Since the Nihonjin man is hardly ever home, the *woman* feels more like she's married into the *house* than into a relationship.
Show on Jisho
582
豪
overpowering
In Orwell's 'Animal Farm' the pigs #overpowered# every other animals. They *crownded* themselves as ruler of the farm and walked *tall* on their rear legs, a crime strictly forbidden in the animal republic.
Show on Jisho
583
腸
intestines
Imagine a child's horror if upon smashing open his *piggy bank*, instead of coins, #instestines#(*flesh*) pours out.
Show on Jisho
584
場
location
You're looking for a good location to bury your *piggy bank* savings. It has to be in some soft *soil* that's easy to dig up, well hidden, and easy to remember like this kanji.
Show on Jisho
585
湯
hot water
Imagine a hot water kettle for your tea, except this one is a pink piggy bank that pours the water from its snout (and squeals when the water is piping hot). Make sure to use a potholder!

羊
sheep
Three horned sheep jumping over the fence.

To a hungry man in China 1000 years ago, a *big sheep* was probably one of the most #beautiful# sights he could see.

Remember the story of Jason and the Argonauts from Greek myth? Jason travelled across *oceans* of *water* in order to recover the fleece of a certain *sheep*

589
詳
detailed
Babe had to remember the detailed *words* of the *sheep* in order to get through to them. Anything less detailed and they will just act like crazy *sheep*.
Show on Jisho
590
鮮
fresh
The freshest *fish* is caught in the middle of the night while most people are "counting *sheep*." (If you've ever been to Tsukiji fish market, you know what I mean)
Show on Jisho
591
達
accomplished
Dolly (the first cloned #sheep# ever) grow tired of being a celebrity and escaped from the labs by digging a tunnel. She turned out to be an ACCOMPLISHED escapist, as she managed to dig a #road# under the #soil#. #/#Imagine Dolly performing a escape, like those movies where the main character has to escape from jail.
Show on Jisho
592
羨
envious
A very thirsty sheep, who always *lacked* *water*, spends his days watching his fellow *sheep* (in the farm next door or in another pen) and being very envious of their *water*.
Show on Jisho
593
差
distinction
This New-Zealand pro-gamer has won many #distinctions# playing *WoolCraft* (a massively multi-user game in which the goal is to shear sheep).
Show on Jisho

着
don
A pullover is donned by pulling wool over your eyes
Show on Jisho
595
唯
solely
Sadly my *mouth* gets to taste *turkey* solely on Christmas Day.
Show on Jisho
596
堆
piled high
During the *Turkey* Holocaust (this is what the animal kingdom calls Thanksgiving - they have really short memories and thus don't recall that it actually happens every single year), *turkeys* are killed en masse, and their bodies are piled high. To keep them from tumbling down, a pile of *dirt* is piled high right next to them to keep them standing upright so that they will be fresh when it is time to eat them.
Show on Jisho
597
椎
sweet oak
I always use SWEET OAK WOOD to add flavor to roasted TURKEY
Show on Jisho
598
誰
who?
[who; someone; somebody] You're alone when, suddenly, you think you hear someone *speak*ing. "#Who#'s there?", you *say*, but there is no answer. Then you find out it was only a *turkey* gobbling. You feel relieved (and ashamed to tell this story). (Based on raulir)
Show on Jisho
599
焦
char
We see here the *roadrunner*, running so fast that it #chars# the ground beneath it, leaving a trace of *fire*.
Show on Jisho

礁
reef
reefs are often formed from volcanic rock, or "rock that has been charred"

集

Gather the turkeys for Thanksgiving. Gather the trees for Christmas. In that order...

准

An iced turkey is only quasi-as-good-as fresh turkey.

進

The first game out on gameboy advance? A little known Japanese game called "*Turkey Road*" -- it was like Mario Kart but everyone had deformed turkey heads!
Show on Jisho
604
雑

You go to the sports outlet to buy a baseball bat, but find that this particular store holds more miscellaneous goods than you could ever imagine. You also buy a christmas tree and a turkey before you head home.
Show on Jisho
605
雌
female
Oh I love this one, it's so silly but fun to picture. Imagine a turkey walking in the snow (in the North pole for example) wearing spoons for snowshoes. Turkeys have small feet so they can use spoons as snowshoes, right ? Now you're looking down at the footprints left by the spoon-wearing turkey who is walking off in the distance, and you think to yourself that those footprints look feminine : curvy and slender.
Show on Jisho
606
準
semi-
The SEMI- finals, in the WATER with TURKEYS took place in TEN lanes (picture 10 turkeys racing each other in a swimming pool)
Show on Jisho
607
奮
stirred up
Gruesome, but it makes it easy to remember. Here goes: The *St. Bernard* stirred up a crowd of *turkeys* and caught one. It bit the head, *brains* spilling onto the *rice field*.

Don't let the neighbor's *St.Bernard* #rob# tonight's *turkey*....*glue* it to the table if you must.

A STONE TURKEY HOUSE made from ROCK has the ASSURANCE of never falling down.

Your *feathers* would also *stand up* if you were a hen in a slaughter house and you heard: "#The following#!"

The poor farmer spends every weekday while the *sun* shines, plucking *turkey* *feathers*.

sayeth
When *pent up* alone, *one* sayeth little.

困
quandary
I'm supposed to make an enclosure for my *tree*, but if I use its *wood* for the enclosure, there won't be anything left to be *pent-in*. What a quandary!
Show on Jisho
622
固
harden
Fossils are *old* things *pent in* that have hardened

錮
weld
RTK supplement: #weld# (metal, harden) - welding the metal bars of a cage together, to *harden* the cage even more... nothing shall escape now!
Show on Jisho
624
国
country
Just think of Japan, a country which is like a jewel but historically very enclosed.
Show on Jisho
625
団
group
When you are admitted into a group like the Yakuza, you're well and truly done (だん) for. You must stick to the group like *glue*, and you will be *pent-in* for life, never being able to leave.
Show on Jisho
626
因
cause
The cause of the big bang (the ultimate cause) was a very *large* amount of matter *pent in* to a point in space.

matrimony
*Women cause* matrimony.
Show on Jisho
628
咽
windpipe
You can't breathe very well, so the doc looks inside your *mouth* to find the *cause*. "Oh, I see the *cause* of your windpipe blockage. There's a St Bernard penned up in there!"
Show on Jisho
629
園
park
This is just like the *lidded crock* wrapped in a *scarf* you had to stay {402} from. This time it's even more dangerous, because it's *pent in* the sandbox in the park, where children play. Who knows what could be inside! Hopefully it's something as harmless as a {403} this time. Who would put something so potentially dangerous in a park, anyway?
Show on Jisho
630
回
-times
Write *mouth* two -times
Show on Jisho
631
壇
podium
A man on the podium announce the rules for the contest: You must fill a *top hat with dirt as many times* as you can by *nightbreak*
Show on Jisho
632
店
store
I kept mixing this up with shop until I found the phrase "in store" like "what is in store for you in the future." Only the store ran by the fortune teller can tell you what is "in store" for you,
Show on Jisho
633
庫
warehouse
I think of the Batcave. It's a big cave that Batman uses as a warehouse to store his car, the Batmobile, and all his cool big-boy toys.
Show on Jisho
634
庭
courtyard
In feudal Japan, they didn't have #court-yards#. They had *court-caves*!
Show on Jisho
635
庁
government office
Some bureaucrats at a government office decided that the tunnels of *caves* need to get *street* signs, which are then *nail*ed to the walls of the *cave*.
Show on Jisho

床
bed
If you're gonna sleep in a CAVE, chop down a TREE to make a comfy BED!
Show on Jisho

麻

Drug lords are growing their *groves* of hemp in *caves* now so that they cannot be spotted by satellites.

"#Grind#, grind, grind the *hemp*, slowly with the *stone*"
Show on Jisho
639
心
heart
Heart needs three drops of blood to work.
Show on Jisho
640
忘
forget
I didn't do well as a doctor. One of my patients *perished* because I #forgot# to put her *heart* back at the end of the surgery. you *perish* if your *heart* #forget# to beat
Show on Jisho
641
恣
selfish
I'm born with two hearts? How lucky! Well I could donate one and save the life of someone else, but I'm one #selfish# bastard.... If my first one fails, I'll just move on to my *next heart*!
Show on Jisho
642
忍
endure
A ninja must be able to endure the pain of clinging to a ceiling, motionless, for hours at a time, waiting for just the right moment to drop down and thrust the *blade* of his sword into the *hearts* of his enemies. By the way, this character is used in the compound 忍者 (*ninja*) which is why I choose to use *ninja* as its primitive meaning.
Show on Jisho
643
認
acknowledge
You would think that most *ninjas* (see previous frame) would acknowledge each other's presence with something like a silent nod. Imagine the consequences if, while raiding an enemy castle, one stupid *ninja* chose to acknowledge another by *saying*, "HELLO!!"
Show on Jisho
644
忌
mourning
Remember the tale of Cleopatra? She was MOURNING the loss of her Marc Antony, so she placed the asp SNAKE to her HEART.
Show on Jisho
645
志
intention
A samurai's intention is to rip out the heart from the enemy
Show on Jisho
646
誌
document
This is quite simple: a document is a set of *words* describing your *intentions*.
Show on Jisho
647
芯
wick
A wick is like a *flower* stem running through the *heart* of a candle.
Show on Jisho
648
忠
loyalty
Dragon Ball reference. Dr. Gero (Android 20) implanted a bomb *inside* the *heart* of the Androids to assure their loyalty
Show on Jisho
649
串
shish kebab
This is a pictograph if ever I saw one. Two chunks of meat on a skewer.
Show on Jisho
650
患
afflicted
If you eat too many *shish kebabs*, your *heart* will be afflicted with cholesterol
Show on Jisho
651
思
think
Think with your *brain* NOT your *heart*.
Show on Jisho
652
恩
grace
Grace is when you give from your *heart* to serve a higher *cause*.
Show on Jisho
653
応
apply
Said the doctor: Usual rules apply. If you apply too much force the *heart* will *cave* in.
Show on Jisho
654
意
idea
When you get a good IDEA you get excited and you can hear the SOUND of your HEART, it's pounding so hard.
Show on Jisho
655
臆
cowardice
Cowardice is when you are not willing to sacrifice your *flesh* for your *ideas*
Show on Jisho
656
想
concept
The mathematical concept was so difficult to grasp, the student grabbed his *wooden* pencil and stabbed himself in the *eye* and through the *heart*.
Show on Jisho
657
息
breath
Your breath brings oxygen in through your *nose* which is then pumped around your body by your *heart*.
Show on Jisho
658
憩
recess
Recess to me is a school break. At recess some kiddies are comparing their latest body piercings. *Tongues* and *noses* are nothing special. The new cool is to have your *heart* done!
Show on Jisho
659
恵
favor
Too easy. Imagine the Wizard of OZ. There, the three heroes asked the Wizard for three FAVORS: the lion wanted courage of TEN men, the scarecrow wanted a BRAIN, and the tin man wanted a HEART. Ok, the lion bit is stretching but you have it memorized now, so who cares?
Show on Jisho
660
恐
fear
If your heart surgeon is mediocre in his craft, you have plenty of reason to fear. ("Oops, I think I left my scissors in there")
Show on Jisho
661
惑
beguile
She was #beguiled#/#mislead# by his charm: at the party he kissed her on the *mouth*, they did it on the *floor *and thus he stole her* heart*. Poor girl!
Show on Jisho
662
感
emotion
Strong EMOTIONS don't stay hidden. They march right out of one's *heart* (below) and out *one*'s *mouth* (shouted, snarled, or gently whispered - depending on exactly what kind of emotion it is!).
Show on Jisho
663
憂
melancholy
This is an image of the crucifixion. Jesus is on the cross. His *crown* of thorns has slipped down and is around his neck, right between his *head* and his *heart*. His *walking legs* can be seen dangling from the cross as well. How MELANCHOLY!
Show on Jisho

寡

This widow is a quire special one: in her house, she keeps the head of her husband and beneath it; the dagger she killed him with.
Show on Jisho

busy
Poor Japanese people are so busy. They work like 80 hour weeks! Slowly, you see them turn into automatons...their bodies still alive, but their *state of mind* like they've long ago *perished*... (Mental image: most stressed out salaryman you know.)
Show on Jisho

ECSTASY alters our STATE OF MIND and makes us DEVILS.

#Lament# is the *state of mind* most *eminent* people live in, because so many expectations lay on their shoulders.

Enlightenment, according to Buddhism, is the *state of mind* when you reject your ego (the *I*) and become one with the universe.

Show on Jisho
673
憎
hate
This kanji is very graphic and suggestive. All you need is just to visualize. STORY: Hate is the *state of mind* when you feel how *horns* of rage are growing right from your *brains* and your *tongue wagging in the mouth* sends curses to the person you hate.

When sitting through laser eye surgery, the surgeon *stretches* open your *eye* with a tight-fitting *tool*. The thought of a laser cutting through the lens of your eye within moments, and possibly blinding you in the case of a mishap, makes for a very disquieting *state of mind*.

A paedophile's *state of mind* is to yearn for *juveniles*.

Think of a commercial designed at making you #hanker# for the product they're advertising. See how they cleverly use that *scenery* to put you in the *state of mind* they desire.

Morticia and Gomez (of the “Addams Family”) are spending their *Valentine's* Day at the *graveyard*, pining for each other's affection.

添

Hawaii is a little drop of *heaven* nestled in the *waters* of the Pacific, most often visited by honeymooners and valentines. It was annexed to the U.S.A. in 1959, and more recently to Japan as well-- albeit only unofficially, and through private commercial holdings
Show on Jisho
685
必
invariably
For this kanji I invariably got the stroke order wrong. I nearly lost *heart*, but decided to *stick* (pun) to it. Then I noticed the order is 1) katakana ソ (altered slightly); 2) fishhook; 3) two drops. Now I invariably get it right.
Show on Jisho

When you're cold, your RUB your FINGERS over your EXTREMITIES vigorously to warm up a bit. I'd still rather go in for a warm fire and some hot cocoa, though.

Imagine you eventually become obsessed by avoiding the manager’s criticism finger and compares the spoons as well as you can.

Show on Jisho
716
推
conjecture
In mathematics, a conjecture is a mathematical statement which has been proposed as a true statement, but which no one has yet been able to prove or disprove. Have you heard of the *Finger-Turkey* conjecture ? It states that if *turkeys* had *fingers*, they would be able to count. Be sure to imagine a turkey with fingers at the tip of its wings, counting from one to ten.
Show on Jisho

揚
hoist
This poor little kid has put his finger into the opening of his piggy bank, and can’t get it out. His creative friends binds a rope to the piggy bank, throws it over a branch and starts to hoist the piggy bank up, hoping to get his finger out of it.

737

The keyword refers to property in the sense of money or funds rather than of buildings or real estate. Keep this one distinct from frame 193 (“wealth”) and frame 473 (“assets”). Here we have a genie, gulping down oysters. Someone tries to grab an oyster and the genie puts his big arms around his oysters and states his “right of ownership” : “They're mines, my property!”.

from
Pictograph, see book. This kanji, as a chinese character, is in fact the origin for the hiragana possessive particle “no”. Try drawing this kanji fast, in a single stroke and you will end up with の.

Imagine a cliché Hollywood situation: one person is lying on the edge of the abyss and another (presumably his *friend*) is hanging, only thing holding him is the grip of their hands. Then *fingers* #slip out# of the grip and he falls in said abyss.
Show on Jisho
762
投
throw
Well, you usually use your *fingers* to throw objects used as *missile* weapons. Easy. By the way, for those of you looking for a less anachronistic image for the *missile* primitive as a modern rocket, try a slingshot. it's a *crotch* (originally a tree branch) that sends missile projectiles flying into/like the *wind*. And for this present kanji, it is something you naturally use with your fingers...

771
肢

The limbs that this kanji represents are *parts of the body* that are connected to the trunk, like the main *branches* to a tree (“arms and legs” is the second meaning of this kanji). In other words, limbs are "*flesh branches*".
Show on Jisho
772

Show on Jisho
774
軽
lightly
Fact: this kanji is used to denote a certain class of vehicles in Japan whose engines are under a certain size (less than 750cc I think) and are called #light# vehicles here. Imagine a so-called #light# vehicle or a #light#-truck with a load of *spools* driving down a road ever so lightly, careful not to let any of the *spools* roll out onto the street.

your *elbow* is *bound up* so that your biceps will stay flexed
Show on Jisho
801
拡
broaden
Spread your *fingers* *wide* to broaden your hand.
Show on Jisho
802
鉱
mineral
*Elbonium*: a new mineral found in *wide caves* shaped like elbows and made of metal.
Show on Jisho

弁
valve
Opening a stuck valve requires 2 hands and a lot of elbow grease.
Show on Jisho
804
雄
male
Men walk with their *elbows* out from their *sides* in a weird *turkey* trot when they try to appear very MASCULINE. Think of a 70's pimp walk.
Show on Jisho

台

When someone's *elbow* is above your *mouth* he/she is probably standing on a pedestal.

neglect
While standing on the *pedestal* at the award ceremony, the recipient *heart*lessly neglected to mention the people that got him there.

An ICE PEDESTAL is useless in METALLURGY since it will just melt.
Show on Jisho
809
始
commence
Many men, before they commence their relationship with the *woman* of their desires, place her on something of a *pedestal*, which often leads to disappointment later on.
Show on Jisho
810
胎
womb
Imagine the #womb# as a *part of the body* which contains a little {744} for the baby to stand on. Picture the baby, like a little statue of a cherub, standing on its pedestal in the fleshy womb.
Show on Jisho
811
窓
window
This is either a love scene or a murder scene that you are seeing through a window. The love scene: through the window of a house (from a distance), you see a pair of human legs, then elbows, and then some pink hearts floating up like in a cartoon. The murder scene: peering through the window of a house, you see a gruesome murder scene. Human legs dangling from a ceiling fan, an elbow sticking out of a wall, and a heart still beating on the carpet.
Show on Jisho
812
去
gone
If you want the soil stains gone from your clothes, then you'll need to put some elbow grease into cleaning them.
Show on Jisho
813
法
method
Following from the last frame; when rubbing isn't good enough, WATER is the best METHOD for making sure the SOIL on your ELBOW is GONE.
Show on Jisho
814
会
meeting
The only thing created in most meetings is a lot of hot air. Imagine a *cloud of it rising* to the *roof*.
Show on Jisho
815
至
climax
Imagine you’re watching an extremely slow motion film about a landslide. You have seen the soil sliding down from a hill for forever, just waiting for the so-called climax: the soil hitting a wall.

A simple room is made up of a roof, some walls, and a dirt floor.

doth
(Archaic English for “does”. Humble form of “to do”) You are, in archaic England, asking to see the taskmaster, but get an unusually honest answer from his manservant: “The taskmaster doth usually reach a climax around this time, I’m afraid you have to wait.”
Show on Jisho

互
mutually
if you can combined your *walls* with another house's *walls*, both houses would mutually benefit, by the increase in size....

Think of a really loud and annoying baby, you want to abandon it but it keeps coming back...so you take of your belt by the buckle, and buckle the baby to a tree!

I will bring up my *infants* to eat *meat*. I'll not endure any vegetarian children in my house!

A terrible yakuza #taskmaster# is #bringing up# his infant. Every time the infant does something wrong... well, you know what happens to yakuzas when they do something wrong.

充
allot
Each *infant* gets its very own pair of *human legs*, #allotted# by God.
Show on Jisho

銃
gun
During war, all *metal* is *allotted* to the effort to make more guns.
Show on Jisho
825
硫
sulfur
One day a woman found an infant near the brim of a volcanic crater (“brimstone” is another name of sulphur) who was made of yellow stone. She brought him back to the village. The next day the village was flooded. The villagers thus cursed the woman for bringing him to the village. -- History: In the 8th century AD. Chinese scientists discovered that an explosive mixture could be produced by combining sulfur, charcoal and nitrate. We have learned {115} and sulfur, charcoal comes in lesson 24.
Show on Jisho

流
current
INFANT Moses placed in the WATER and sent down the current of the STREAM

license
In MMA fighting, you have great LICENSE to use your *elbows* and *legs*

tempt
Prostitutes in Amsterdam have a *license* to show off their *walking legs* and tempt customers with their *mouths*

exit
Suddenly, a *cactus* comes out of the ground with a sign that reads: exit. Now you can leave the desert! (Note: giving this primitive the meaning 'cactus' can be useful later)

Someone is tumbling around the mountains, and it starts to get dark. When you suddenly walks on to a branch (of a tree), you are definitely branched off, finding yourself in a forest instead of a mountain.

The house invariably divided into hexagons and is full of insects is where the honey comes from.
Show on Jisho
839
嵐

What a storm! Even a *mountain* was carried off by the *wind*!
Show on Jisho
840
崎
promontory
This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with *mountain* in place of *soil*. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives* stone* and *strange*. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names.
Show on Jisho
841
崖
bluffs
Standing at the base of the bluffs I announce, "I'm going to climb those *ivy-covered cliffs*, and then the *mountain* on top of them." My friends don't believe me, "He bluffs!" they say.
Show on Jisho
842
入
enter
This character is meant to be a picture of someone walking leftwards, putting one leg forward in order to enter someplace. Since the “in” side of a character is the left, it should be easy to remember the writing of this character.
Show on Jisho
843
込
crowded
During a traffic jam it is impossible to get your car to *enter* the *roadway* as it is crowded with cars. Think of a grid lock so bad cars are litterally scraping up against each other like people on a Japanese train during rush hour.
Show on Jisho
844
分
part
When something is *entered* by a *dagger*, it ends up being cut in several #parts#.
Show on Jisho
845
貧
poverty
In the case of true poverty, not having money is only part of the problem. There are other components as well, like lack of education, class structuring, etc., but that doesn't really matter. Just remember that the money is only part of it, not the whole.

The PART of my HEAD where I remember the KANJI is in the kanji PARTITION.

I always open the doors to the public restrooms with my elbows because I don't want to touch the door with my hands.

The TREES in PUBLIC parks are usually pine trees.

Used in school's dining #hall# 食堂. Story: The food is so bad that you throw it to the *ground* and run to the *outhouse*.

It's usual to take your *towel* with your when you go to the *outhouse* at the onsen (hot springs bath in Japan) so everybody doesn't see your stuff.

Compared to pants, a SKIRT is the GARMENT to be wearing when you want to use one of those Japanese toilets. It makes it so much easier: you just walk in the OUTHOUSE hike it up, and do your business.

掌
manipulate
Instead of magazines, we keep a Rubiks Cube in the *outhouse* to #manipulate# with your *hands* while you do your business.
Show on Jisho
865
皮
pelt
A pelt is hooked on a branch. A small tent is made with a pelt and a branch planted in the ground. The mnemonic hints at the first stroke (the hanging pelt) and the hook at the end of the second stroke. This is chinese radical #107 meaning “skin”.
Show on Jisho

waves
The Inuit used *water*-proof seal *pelts* for their kayaks, to travel the waves.

882
