並
row
This is a simplification of 竝, a ideogram of *two* people *standing* in a row.
Show on Jisho
1925
普
universal
People at Universal Studios wait in rows so long that the sun goes down.
Show on Jisho
1926
譜
musical score
Musical scores are in a universal language.
Show on Jisho
1927
湿
damp
You first wash you clothes with *water* and wring them until they are just damp before hanging them in a *row* under the *sun* to dry. If you don't wring them damp first they will take days to dry!
Show on Jisho
1928
顕
appear
One day a *row* of *Suns* appeared in the sky, turning everyone's *heads* upwards.
Show on Jisho
1929
繊
slender
*Spiderman* has to stay slender, so during *thanksgiving*, he keeps away from the long *row* of food.
Show on Jisho
1930
霊
spirits
After *raining* for *two* days in a *row*, you plead with the #SPIRITS# for some relief. (Adapted from johnskb,21-5-2006)
Show on Jisho
1931
業
profession
A truly gruesome profession: an abattoir worker. Where the carcasses are *upside down in a row* that have *not yet* been cut up into sausages and steaks.
Show on Jisho
1932
撲
slap
This kanji is also used for "Sumo." 相撲(P); 角力 【すもう】 (n) sumo wrestling; (P). STORY: In professional SUMO only HUSBANDS participate (b/c they are old and experienced), and they use their HANDS to either SLAP each other out of the ring, or throw them UPSIDE DOWN into the first ROW of audience. (right primitive = SUMO WRESTLER)
Show on Jisho
1933
僕
me
Building on johnskb: Although it goes against the Heisig method, this story is a lot easier to remember when you know it's the kanji for "boku." Males usually use either "boku" or "ore" (instead of "watashi") to refer themselves. "Boku" is slightly boyish and soft; "ore" is rough & tough. Mr. T would definitely use "ore" -- but when he's one of the husbands hung upside down in a row about to be punished by his wife, he puts on a sweet act and switches to "boku" when he pleads "come on baby, it's ME!"
Show on Jisho
1934
共
together
The conjoined twins, who are always together, have trouble eating together because one is a vegetarian, eating *salad* and the other is a avid meat eater, eating *chicken legs*.[Thanks fuaburisu!]
Show on Jisho
1935
供
submit
*Person* + *Together*: You have to be *together* with another *person* when you submit a request to get into the ark. (Two of each creature, one male, one female) 供(P); 伴 【とも】 (n,vs) (See お供, おとも) accompanying; attendant; companion; retinue; (P) 供える 【そなえる】 (v1,vt) to offer; to sacrifice; to dedicate;
Show on Jisho
1936
異
uncommon
It's uncommon to find a pair of *together twins* who are connected at the brain! When such a set does turn up, they are inevitably showcased on TV.
Show on Jisho
1937
翼
wing
Up until the late Jurassic period, it was *uncommon* to find *feathers* on wings
Show on Jisho
1938
戴
accept humbly
At *Thanksgiving*, it’s *uncommon* for people to accept humbly the food: most people just dig in.
Show on Jisho
1939
洪
deluge
Lots of water coming together is called a deluge.
Show on Jisho
1940
港
harbor
During a *deluge*, all the poor *snakes* get washed into the #harbour#.
Show on Jisho
1941
暴
outburst
Having spent all *day* *stringing together* *grains of rice* he suddenly had an outburst, "I can take it any longer!"
Show on Jisho
1942
爆
bomb
Bombs make fiery outbursts. It's almost too logical, this one.
Show on Jisho
1943
恭
respect
If you respect your girlfriend you will definitely spend Valentine's day together.
Show on Jisho
1944
選
elect
You're driving on the road and you see two snakes together. You can't avoid both, so you have to elect which one gets run over.
Show on Jisho
1945
殿
Mr.
This is the #Mr.# (との) used when addressing someone at the start of a letter. How letters were delivered to the *ark* was intersting. Noah would wave a big *flag* and the post man would fire a *flag*-seeking *missile* full of letters for #Mr# Rhino and #Mr# Giraffe etc.
Show on Jisho
1946
井
well
This is a picto of the grate over top of the well at 大阪城, so no one falls in.
Show on Jisho
1947
丼
donburi
A little one is eating a domburi while standing over, looking down into, a WELL. He drops it, and it falls down & down until it looks like nothing more than a DROP, landing at the bottom of the well!
Show on Jisho
1948
囲
surround
Tweaking dingomick's story: The village *well* is *pent in* by a surrounding wall so that kids don't fall in. 囲む (かこむ): to surround, encircle 範囲 (はんい): range, extent, scope 周囲 (しゅうい): surroundings, environs, periphery, perimeter, circumference 囲う (かこう): to enclose, fence in 囲い (かこい): enclosure, fenced in area (such as a corral or a pen) DOLBY SURROUND Careful: {僚}.
Show on Jisho
1949
耕
till
If you just grow your christmas tree in a well, there will be no need to till the soil.
Show on Jisho
1950
亜
Asia
In Asian countries, people use *II* chopsticks to get things into their *mouths*. Just imagine someone shoving a piece of sushi into their mouths with chopsticks.
Show on Jisho
1951
悪
bad
Because *Asian* people started to eat Western food, their *hearts* became bad and they started having *heart* attacks.
Show on Jisho
1952
円
circle
A poor old man is almost killing himself trying to lift a huge *glass hood* with his *cane* (using it as a lever), to get to just *one* yen coin. Note : the kanji refers to a circular, round object, but also to the Japanese currency (pronounced "en").
Show on Jisho
1953
角
angle
A museum display of two walking sticks bound together under a glass canopy, showing the first device used to measure an angle.
Show on Jisho
1954
触
contact
For *insects* to get in contact with each other, they need to place their antennae at just the right *angle*.
Show on Jisho
1955
解
unravel
Unravel the mystery by determining at what ANGLE the SWORD went into the COW.
Show on Jisho
1956
再
again
This is a *belt* with a non-adjustable *jeweled* buckle. Everytime you go back to the leathersmith telling him to move the buckle because you've packed on a few pounds (but that this is the last time!), he says "Again?!? Weren't you just here last month?"
Show on Jisho
1957
講
lecture
Image: a professor walking around with a *funnel* and simply pouring his *words* into each students head instead of a #lecture#. (Primitive: *FUNNEL*, who got the *celery* stuck in the funnel *again*?! You know it's not supposed to be used for that!) FUNNEL primitive: "*Celery--again*?!" "You'll eat your *celery* or else I'll make you eat it with a FUNNEL!"
Show on Jisho
1958
購
subscription
Subscription is like a money funnel, because the receiving end is small (just one company) and the other end is wide (the whole country).
Show on Jisho
1959
構
posture
A farm girl uses a *wooden funnel* as a corset to improve her posture.
Show on Jisho
1960
溝
gutter
A gutter *funnels* *water*.
Show on Jisho
1961
論
argument
*Words* must he chosen *methodically* to make a good argument. Note: 侖 {20374} is an extremely rare kanji meaning "methodical", I remember this with: "A meeting of scrapbookers who are very methodical."
Show on Jisho
1962
倫
ethics
侖 = think or be methodical. A *person* who *thinks or acts methodically* has ethics. 五倫 【ごりん】 (n) the 5 Confucian filial-piety relationships; 社内不倫 【しゃないふりん】 (n) adulterous affair with someone at work; 人倫 【じんりん】 (n) human relations; humanity; 精力絶倫 【せいりょくぜつりん】being of unbounded energy or sexual stamina; 沈倫 【ちんりん】sinking into obscurity; 破倫 【はりん】 (n) immorality; incest; 比倫 【ひりん】
Show on Jisho
1963
輪
wheel
You have to be *methodical*. Before you invent the *car*, you'll need to invent the wheel.
Show on Jisho
1964
偏
partial
Right side: scrapbook on your door = *Heisig kanji poster*. Story: A *person* with a *Heisig kanji poster* is partial to the Heisig method
Show on Jisho
1965
遍
everywhere
Go down the road in Japan and you will find comics EVERYWHERE, newpaper stands, 7-11, Tsutaya, even the supermarket. Comics are everywhere here along the road.
Show on Jisho
1966
編
compilation
I took the compilation of covers of all my *Spider-Man* comics that I had saved in a *scrapbook* and glued them on my door.
Show on Jisho
1967
冊
tome
A pictograph of The Lord of the Rings Trilogy viewed end on: All *3* tomes held together with *one ribbon* - "one ribbon to bind them all". 冊 さつ 1: counter for books A heavy scrapbook so full that flowers are sticking out. Only if a scrapbook is that full, it can be called a heavy book.
Show on Jisho
1968
柵
palisade
A palisade is a "fence of stakes especially for defense," usually the stakes are very strong, set closely together, and pointed on top. *Tome* can be seen as a pictograph of several close-set *wooden* stakes, braced by one horizontal bar.
Show on Jisho
1969
典
code
This kanji means a code of law, not a secret language or symbolic language (such as programming code) ... Story: The code of law is a *tool* used to *bend* citizens to society's will. You can use the image of a totalitarian state, but be careful not to confuse it with the pinnacle primitive {1294}
Show on Jisho
1970
氏
family name
Looks a bit like Ft => #F#amily #t#itle => Family name
Show on Jisho
1971
紙
paper
Spiderman regrets getting drunk last night. Peter Parker hands in his paper with the name Peter Spiderman--wrong family name. Oops!
Show on Jisho
1972
婚
marriage
Tip: Heisig later introduces the kanji 昏 {2451}. Story: Never enter into marriage with a *woman* at *dusk* (wait until you see them in daylight). Note: This is an ancient proverb . . . (probably)
Show on Jisho
1973
低
lower
Primitive: The Japanese always *underline* their *family name* on their #Calling (Business) Cards#. (Easy to remember, Underlined Family Name = Business Card) A person bows low when presenting his business card.
Show on Jisho
1974
抵
resist
Most japanese find it impossible to resist pushy businessmen in Japan when they push their damned *business cards* into your *fingers*.
Show on Jisho
1975
底
bottom
At the bottom of the *cave* you find a *meishi*: "LOST? DIAL 1-800-..." I put all those useless business cards at the bottom of a cave.
Show on Jisho
1976
民
people
Note: *Vox populi* means "voice of the people" referring to people as nation. This is often used as an abbreviation of the phrase "*Vox populi, vox dei*" which means "voice of the people, voice of god", referring to the godlike power people have over their government. In this context, I think of this character as an angry mob that is rebelling against it's corrupt government (hence we have big *mouths* which call out the unwanted officials by their *family name*).
Show on Jisho
1977
眠
sleep
People need to close their eyes to sleep.
Show on Jisho
1978
捕
catch
I was retreating from the battlefield. In the chaos, my friend threw his dogtags at me to give to his family. I managed to catch them with my fingers as the chopper was lifting off.
Show on Jisho
1979
哺
suckle
The extremely efficient (military veteran) wet-nurse keeps track of which infant has been #SUCKLE#d already by marking each *MOUTH* with a *DOG-TAG*. (Cf. {689})
Show on Jisho
1980
浦
bay
The *water* of the #bay# washes all the *dog tags* up after the battle.
Show on Jisho
1981
蒲
bullrush
The bulrush is a *flower* that grows around *bays*. http://www.meltonrossnewbarnetby.co.uk/images/bulrush.jpg
Show on Jisho
1982
舗
shop
A shop in an impoverished country is just a cottage with a dog tag identifying it.
Show on Jisho
1983
補
supplement
I usually hear supplement in "dietry supplement". So you're given a *cloak* for extra fibre and *dogtags* for extra iron. Keeps you regular and stops you feeling tired and run-down.
Show on Jisho
1984
邸
residence
So fed up am I, I've finally built *city walls* around my residence to keep these Japanese from soliciting me with their *business cards*.
Show on Jisho
1985
郭
enclosure
Even the *tall* *kids* can't get out of the enclosure that is the *city walls*.
Show on Jisho
1986
郡
county
County cricket. "I say *old boy*, you've hit that ball clear over the *city walls*. That's six and out!"
Show on Jisho
1987
郊
outskirts
The city folks don't like to *mingle* with people from the outskirts. That's why they built such big *city walls*.
Show on Jisho
1988
部
section
Within the *city walls*, this section of town was so noisy that we had to *muzzle* them up.
Show on Jisho
1989
都
metropolis
A vision of a futuristic METROPOLIS: standing at the window of your 400th floor apartment, hand in hand with your LOVE DOLL, gazing out at the gigantic CITY WALLS that you can never escape.
Show on Jisho
1990
郵
mail
The *drooping* *citywalls* was generating a lot of angry #mail# for the city officials.
Show on Jisho
1991
邦
home country
He reminisced about his home country: "Ah, back in my home country, the *bushes* grew so high that they covered the *city walls*!"
Show on Jisho
1992
那
interrogative
If you arrive with *two swords* at the *city walls*, expect some interrogatives before they'll let you in. Phonetic ナ. If a trespasser attempts to cross the city walls, the guards will likely employ the interrogative approach of pointing a double-edged sword at them. Sort of shorthand for "Who goes there?". Note: "two" is written before final stroke of 刀.
Show on Jisho
1993
郷
hometown
Your hometown is where you broke out of your cocoon (born), and where you left when your hair was silver (died), your whole life was spent inside the city walls.
Show on Jisho
1994
響
echo
My hometown is a ghost town, any sounds echoes and echoes.
Show on Jisho
1995
郎
son
Just like a daughter (娘) is good woman, son is good too, and stays safely inside city walls so as not to give his parents reason to worry.
Show on Jisho
1996
廊
corridor
Your *son* plays in the corridor pretending he's exploring a *cave*.
Show on Jisho
1997
盾
shield
You paint 10 huge eyes on your shield to scare the enemy, but consequently your shield is so big and heavy that you have to drag it
Show on Jisho
1998
循
sequential
This is mostly used in the word 循環, "circulation" (of buses through their routes, of blood, etc). So I think of a column of little Roman soldiers with their shields marching sequentially through the veins of a person, as an anthropomorphization of the immune system.
Show on Jisho
1999
派
faction
Drag + rag gave me trouble until I came up with zombie for it. The zombie population became more diverse, separating into different factions. One of them being the water Zombies.
Show on Jisho
2000
脈
vein
The vein is the part of the body most lusted after by the flesh hungry zombies (drag & rag - see revenantkioku frame 1855).
Show on Jisho
2001
衆
masses
Masses of zombies, splattered with blood. (any zombie movie)
Show on Jisho
2002
逓
parcel post
In the ancient #parcel post#, they just would *drag* the packages behind them tied to *cornstalks* woven into a long *belt* down the *road*. It was a wonder than anything arrived intact.
Show on Jisho
2003
段
grade
In order to get your 1st grade, or first-dan (だん) black belt, you have to learn hand to hand combat with new weapons - first the grapple involving the *staple gun*, and then the *missile* deployment technique.
Show on Jisho
2004
鍛
forge
As a discriminating metalsmith, I use the highest grade metals when forging such precision devices as staple guns and missiles.
Show on Jisho
2005
后
empress
The empress is cruel. Normally she'll violently pull her servants by the ear when they've failed to follow orders. But *one time* she *dragged* this one guy around the palace by the *mouth*. She must have been really angry—ever since that moment, he's never been seen again.
Show on Jisho
2006
幻
phantasm
After the play, The Phantasm of the Opera hangs up his cape on a *clothes hanger* and returns to his *cocoon* to sleep.
Show on Jisho
2007
司
director
The director sticks a *clothes hanger* in each actor's *mouth* and hangs them from the *ceiling* until he needs them.
Show on Jisho
2008
伺
pay respects
*Mr. T* is the *director*. You better #pay respects# to him!
Show on Jisho
2009
詞
parts of speech
The big mouthed *director* is even picky about the #parts of speech# you use, shouting, "More verbs! Less adjectives!" and such all the time.
Show on Jisho
2010
飼
domesticate
When you DOMESTICATE a animal, you are the DIRECTOR of it's life and what it EATS.
Show on Jisho
2011
嗣
heir
The *director*'s *mouth* dropped open as he flipped through the *scrapbook* of properties he was about to become #heir# to.
Show on Jisho
2012
舟
boat
I see this kanji as a pictograph of a two story boat seen from the front. The *glass canopy* is the body of the boat. The *drop* on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the *ceiling/floor* between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the *two drops* in the middle are the lights on the decks.
Show on Jisho
2013
舶
liner
Cruise Liners are huge *boats* that always seem to be *white*
Show on Jisho
2014
航
navigate
To navigate a "boat" through a "whirlwind" takes a skilled #navigator#. Nami ^_^
Show on Jisho
2015
舷
gunwale
The gunwale is perhaps the most *mysterious* part of a *boat* for it is neither a #gun# nor a #whale#.
Show on Jisho
2016
般
carrier
In general, carrier boats have missiles.
Show on Jisho
2017
盤
tray
What do you call a "CARRIER" of DISHes? A TRAY.
Show on Jisho
2018
搬
conveyor
When workers neglect workplace safety, their fingers get cut off and carried away by the conveyor belt, which looks like a 'finger carrier' in that case.
Show on Jisho
2019
船
ship
A boy floats his toy *boat* in a *gully* and imagines it as an immense #ship#.
Show on Jisho
2020
艦
warship
A warship is a *boat* that *oversees* the seas. Think of it as the patroller of the ocean.
Show on Jisho
2021
艇
rowboat
In venice, the *boat* used by the *courts* to transport criminals is a rowboat.
Show on Jisho
2022
瓜
melon
M for melon. 瓜elon
Show on Jisho
2023
弧
arc
When you use a *bow* to shoot a *melon*, the arc varies depending on how far away you are.
Show on Jisho
2024
孤
orphan
An orphan will never know the joys on sucking on his mother's melons........
Show on Jisho
2025
繭
cocoon
This is a simple two-column manga showing the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a cocoon. First, the caterpillar gets under a large flower (bees tend to hang around flowers, which scare away other predators). Then, in the first frame, we see the caterpillar (*insect*). Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the *insect* covered with *thread*, making a beautiful cocoon.
Show on Jisho
2026
益
benefit
The benefit of being an animal with *horns* and fast *legs* is in keeping it from becoming a *dish* for the other animals! (shaydwyrm)
Show on Jisho
2027
暇
spare time
Some jackass-like people have way too much spare time. You can find video's of them all over the internet, if you like such things, you can watch it all *day*. You see them *stapling* their *mouths* shut, or throwing eachother *upside down in boxes* or kicking each other in the *crotch*.
Show on Jisho
2028
敷
spread
*Arrowheads* are #spread# all over the *field*. The *taskmaster* profiteerer forces you to find them all using a *compass*.
Show on Jisho
2029
来
come
When I come home, there's nobody and no dinner waiting for me. Sigh...*rice* for *one* again.
Show on Jisho
2030
気
spirit
*Wolverine* has a fighting spirit, and even while *reclining* on the *floor* sharpens the *hooks* on his claws
Show on Jisho
2031
汽
vapor
Vapor is the *water's* *spirit* with no *x*, the unknown quantity for soul.
Show on Jisho
2032
飛
fly
Hooks with small wings attached look like hummingbirds with a long beak. Two hummingbirds are trying to fly away with our little measuring box. What do they want it for?
Show on Jisho
2033
沈
sink
This is the famous story of Archimedes and the Crown, where buoyancy was discovered. Watching the *crown* sink in the *water*, Archimedes detected the fraud and ran naked through the city (*human legs* distorted from running) yelling "Eureka! Eureka!" See http://math.nyu.edu/~crorres/Archimedes/Crown/CrownIntro.html and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eureka_%28word%29
Show on Jisho
2034
枕
pillow
The guy who was thrown into the river to sink was given one last request. "If I'm gonna be sleeping with the fishes," he said, "can I at least have a pillow? I'm real sensitive." The mafia bosses laughed. "Look, my doctor said I can only use *wooden* pillows, I have a real serious condition. Can I at least die comfortable-like?" The mafia dudes said fine, and let him have his pillow. They tossed him the river and drove off...and after a minute, he bobbed to the top, thanks to his floating *wood* pillow.
Show on Jisho
2035
妻
wife
Your wife's fingernails are like ten rakes clawing into you. What a savage woman.
Show on Jisho
2036
凄
nifty
I prefer keyword "terrific" for this as the Japanese meaning can be either "great" or "dreadful". Story: freezing your wife is a terrific idea, she can still look pretty and you don't have to listen to all the nagging. Sugoi! Sugoi! Ice Wife Sugoi!
Show on Jisho
2037
衰
decline
If you thought that the dude in 哀 was pathetic, you haven't seen him after his decline. Here he is carrying a stick around in his mouth like a dog, begging people to throw it for him. Note that the mouth is closed only after the stick goes in, as is only logical.
Show on Jisho
2038
衷
inmost
Besides making money from acting like a dog (see decline), the *pathetic* man has risked his inmost internal organs by becoming a *cane* swallower!
Show on Jisho
2039
面
mask
When Jim Carrey puts on #The Mask#, he can make it seem like he has *100 eyes* popping out of his head.
Show on Jisho
2040
麺
noodles
I always eat *barley* noodles with a *mask* on - it stops them splashing in your face.
Show on Jisho
2041
革
leather
In this leather belt there are *20* (廿) small holes or *openings* (口) made with a *needle* (十) to compensate for increases in girth.
Show on Jisho
2042
靴
shoes
*Leather* shoes are nice because they *change* shape to fit your foot.
Show on Jisho
2043
覇
hegemony
In the old west, animal skins were made into leather and their flesh was eaten, thus using the whole animal, which viewed from the animal side could be taken as humans asserting complete hegemony over them. All your base are belong to us.
Show on Jisho
2044
声
voice
When an enemy's *flag* is raised, a true *samurai* can *split* it in half with just his voice.
Show on Jisho
2045
眉
eyebrow
(+astridtops) #Eyebrows# are like *flags* that are raised above your *eyes*. The *flag* is divided because otherwise that would be a monobrow.
Show on Jisho
2046
呉
give
This kanji does not mean "give" as in "give to someone." It means "give" in the sense that someone gave you something, or did something for your benefit when combined with a gerund (-te/-de form) of a verb. STORY: Your working in a factory and your hand gets stuck in one of the gears. You yell with a big MOUTH, "HELP!" and one of your co-workers runs over, GIVES YOU a HAND-CRANK TOOL, and goes back to work. =(
Show on Jisho
2047
娯
recreation
"Give me a woman (女を呉れ！) for my recreation!"
Show on Jisho
2048
誤
mistake
It is a rookie #mistake# to believe the *words* when your sweetie says "You don't have to *give* me anything for my birthday." Trust me, your sweetie wants something, something shiny, and if you disappoint, you will suffer.
Show on Jisho
2049
蒸
steam
This kanji is used in compounds for the steaming of food and also for smoking/fumigation. Here we have the Japanese once again trying to replicate the French cuisine, only with a twist, steaming food with flowers (think of flower-smoked ham for example). Flowers must first be *completely soaked in water*, and then poured over a thin piece of *flooring* under which there is an *oven fire*.
Show on Jisho
2050
承
acquiesce
To get someone to acquiesce, duck them *completely* in *aqua* (=*water*) *three* times. (variation on dingomick's)
Show on Jisho
2051
函
bin
(thegeezer3) Damn racoons... I'll show them. I'll put a SNARE in the BIN as well as a few SPARKLERS so as to scare the shit out of the buggers, then hit them with a SHOVEL.
Show on Jisho
2052
極
poles
(modified Katsuo) Can simplify this using {1243}. You travel to the *poles*, a frozen wasteland. In desperate need of food you try to set up a snare but the tree is *decayed* (see story for {1243}) so you catch no prey. The brutal cold first attacks your *mouth* as your lips turn blue, then your *crotch* also gets cold as your body fails; finally you fall to the *floor*.
Show on Jisho
2053
牙
tusk
The kanji looks like an elephant with tusks. the box is the elephant's eye. The final stroke is the tusk
Show on Jisho
2054
芽
bud,sprout
Unfortunately, this must be a sad story. Poachers lure the elefants with #buds# (of *flowers*) so they can kill them to get their *ivory*.

2055
邪
wicked
The #wicked# queen builds her *city walls* out of menacing *tusks*.
Show on Jisho
2056
雅
gracious
To not confuse it with {606} or {721}, think of the phrase "Goodness gracious." Like: "Goodness gracious! A *turkey* with *tusks*!"

2057
釈
interpretation
The magical shakuhachi can easily give interpretation for any animal tracks, just like it can be used to translate words (訳).

2058
番
turn
[turn; number in a series] Ok, I'm done - now it's your #turn# to count the *drops* of *rice* in the *rice field*...

2059
審
hearing
At your divorce hearing the judge tells you to roll *dice* to see who keeps the *house*. ("I can't believe what I'm hearing!" you say)
Show on Jisho
2060
翻
flip
Don't play *dice* with birds. When you're not looking, they'll flip the *dice* with their *feathers*.
Show on Jisho
2061
藩
clan
This character refers to feudal clans that were abolished in 1871 (Meiji 4) in favor of prefectures (廃藩置県), and thus were predecessors of the modern prefectures. As we know from 落, flowers and water drops each have their own way of falling. This character says that clans' location was decided in the way flowers, water drops and dice fall: at random. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_%28country_subdivision%29
Show on Jisho
2062
毛
fur
I've heard of people having hair on the back of their hands, but this is ridiculous! That's not hair, that's #fur#!
Show on Jisho
2063
耗
decrease
The amount of "fur" (needles) on a Christmas tree decreases, until it doesn't look all that good.
Show on Jisho
2064
尾
tail
A FLAG of FUR is a TAIL
Show on Jisho
2065
宅
home
This kanji is, of course, pronounced "taku", and it seems the owner of this home is a little bit otaku himself. He has hung up *locks of hair* suruptitiously obtained from various females all over his *house*. A veritable hair fetishist, and certainly someone whose home you wouldn't want to visit.
Show on Jisho
2066
託
consign
In "The Lord of the Rings", Galadriel consigned a lock of her hair to Gimli the dwarf, along with some wise words.
Show on Jisho
2067
為
do
Tell a story - a reluctant magician is asked to do a trick. The audience chant 'Do it, do it!', so eventually he does one. He takes a *drop* of water (stroke 1), drops it on the ground where it runs down and smears out (stroke 2). It drops down two steps (strokes 3 and 4) (imagine some nice setting with steps), growing and becoming multicoloured, like a petrol drop, as it goes. Then at the bottom the magician touches it with his wand and you see it has turned into a set of peacock's *tail feathers*.

Not really a story but I believe that giving special attention to a kanji is also a good way to remember it and this one was selected as #"Kanji of the year 2007"#. http://www.japanprobe.com/?p=3368

Wanna lengthen the distance you can shoot? Use a *longbow*!

notebook

hair of the head
Japanese teenage girls consider the style of the hair of the head very important. If a particular style is trendy, soon they all want their own *hair* in the same *shape* as that of their *friends*.

You use a flag to wrap up a salad for a picnic and bind it with a hairpin. Now imagine unfolding it to open up the bounty you've fixed up for yourself.

*Ten* days ago, our *two mouths* met for the last time... then she gave me her *hairpin* as a sayounara gift. How I miss my Geisha girl...

The wise old OWL makes her nest out of FRUIT, carving out the middle for her chicks, because then it's less work: no running back & forth to get food!

挙
raise
The *owl* was asked to #raise# his *hand* if he needed anything, but he had a wing, not a *hand*! So he made a *tool* that looked like a *hand* which he used when he needed to #raise# his *hand*. For #raise#ing, *owl* has a *tool* *hand*.

This *owl*'s reputation skyrocketed after he created a *tool* in order to speak human *words*.

2090
猟
game hunting
[game-hunting; shooting; game; bag] According to unicode.org and wwwjdic, 鼡 and 鼠 ({2065}) are variants. So, for 鼡 (which I'll call #rat#) I have: an *owl*, flying in the *wind*, can easily spot a #rat# even if it's hiding in the *cornstalks*. Now 猟 is easy: *wild dogs* are having fun by #game-hunting# *rat*s.

2094
烏
crow
A crow is a *bird*, but *not a white one*. MEANING: write *bird*, but skip writing *one* in *white*.
Show on Jisho
2095
蔦
vine
Note : if you'll remember we already have a primitive for "ivy", but it was completely made up from the "square jewel" kanji. The kanji here refers to ivy, or vine, and is used in a particular compound for "Hedera rhombea", which is a type of ivy native to Japan. This vine here produces a lot of flowers, and attracts many small birds, which is sure to cheer up even the most depressed Japanese gardener.
Show on Jisho
2096
鳩
pigeon
Pigeons are the birds that come in hordes after baseball games to eat all the trash left by fans.

鶏
chicken
the *vulture's* *husband* is a chicken...heck...who am I to judge their interspecies love? They're both *birds* so its cool.

島
island
This island is the home of the terrible mythical bird Roc. It sits mighty atop the mountain waiting for the next hapless ship to pass by.
Show on Jisho
2099
暖
warmth
A massive group of *migrating ducks* is blocking the warmth of the *sun* as they pass over your house/barbecue/picnic. Their formation is so humongous they block the warmth for a good 10 minutes while they pass over. Mnemonic for the *migrating ducks* primitive : the migrating ducks stick together like the best of *friends*, flying together *as one* (fifth stroke), they are not easy prey for the *great eagles / vultures*.

媛
beautiful woman
You want to know about a beautiful woman? There's a *woman* that's so beautiful, the *birds migrate* to her instead of the sun!
Show on Jisho
2101
援
abet
This kanji is in the word 援助(えんじょ) which means to #support# or assist. The word abet suggests that you are helping or #support#ing something that is morally wrong. #Support# is a much better choice for this kanji. Story: The *migrating ducks* left a little early this year, leaving one duck behind. He gives them the finger and says thanks "Thanks for the #support#, assholes!"

緩
slacken
oh no! *Spiderman* has some *migrating ducks* stuck in his web, he has to slacken it so they can get out.

2103
属
belong
[WARNING: violent story] Two teams of #insects# are playing “capture the #flag#” (ala Unreal Tournament). All of them wear ammunition #belts#. Here you try to take the #flag# of the opponent team, when you are faced by an #insect#: “You’ll get our #flag# over my dead body!”. You reply: “All your base are BELONG to us!”, shoot him on the head, take the #flag# and run away. See the #drop# of blood flowing from his head?

遡
go upstream
You decide to go salmon fishing, so you ride a *mountain goat* to the top of the *road*. Under the light of the *moon*, as it's illegal, you catch the salmon #going upstream#. You accidentally ran over and killed the holy mountain goat on the road. Frightened by the view of the dead body and to save your own body from the angry villagers, you decide to run away from your bloodstained vehicle, jump into the river, and go upstream to hide your tracks.

Show on Jisho
2115
剛
sturdy
Anything sturdy in Japan is associated with *Mount* Fuji. Perhaps this is because it's symmetry is believed to make it rather sturdy itself, unlike all those crooked mountains that are around and tend to fall apart (think rock slides, avalanches, etc.). Here we see Sturdy-brand *sabers* with *Mount* Fuji engraved on the blade.
Show on Jisho

tin can
Horses kept in the mountains have a unique savory taste. At least so the text on this tin can would have us believe, which contains 100% authentic mountain horse.

pottery
Pottery is an obsolete art up in the super-modern Utopia of *The Pinnacle* ... instead, they *bind up* everything they need to preserve in high-tech *tin cans*

揺
swing

For swing: I'm sitting on a swing when a *condor* comes by and picks up the whole swing set with its big *finger*-like claws and now I'm swinging in mid-air. Weeeeeeeee!!!!!

謡
Noh chanting

2120
鬱
gloom
In the middle of the final GROVE you find a TIN CAN. There's a CROWN inside! You are very excited with this, but then someone appears behind you: "Hey, gimme that kid!" You look and it's WOLVERINE, with a SHOVEL on his back and all covered in {2866}. "I found that crown in the rocksalt mines over there, so hand it over!" - You unwillingly hand him the crown and he goes away. Then you SIT ON THE FLOOR, feeling impotent, and the SHAPE of your face becomes all #GLOOMY ☹ (完)#

It was the #groundbreaking# of the new farm, but there was an uninvited guest to the ceremony. It was a famous *skunk*, the one with the familiar *silver* stripe. The feet of the crowd rushing from the ceremony site churned up the *soil* very nicely. The ceremony was ruined but the #groundbreaking# was a great success.

2126
免
excuse
Obviously this is the rabbit from Alice, excusing himself and rushing away on his legs, as he has a binding day schedule. This is at the same time an image, with bound=ears, day=head and legs are just legs. The image is used in {2093}

2128
晩
nightfall
This is EASY!!! Japanese people see a RABBIT ON THE MOON (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_rabbit ) and so nightfall is when the *sun* leaves to make way for the *rabbit* At nightfall the sun excuses itself and goes to sleep.

exertion
Notice how BUGS BUNNY's legs (hint about stroke extension) are starting to get big MUSCLES? It must be because he's always EXERTING himself on the run from Elmer Fudd (or from kicking the shit out of Elmer Fudd when he catches up!!).

elephant
An elephant has huge ears, like a *rabbit*, and a big, fat body, like a *sow*.

像
statue
In India, you see a lot of statues of the Hindu god Ganesha. Easy to recognize: he's the *person* with the *elephant* head.
Show on Jisho
2132
馬
horse
Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of 隹 as wings, then horses are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail "feathers". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though.
Show on Jisho
2133
駒
pony
The cute little innocent-looking plastic #pony# on the desk of a student is in fact a *trojan horse*, hiding *phrases* in its belly which are used for cheating during an exam. No #pony# will be permitted on desks during tests!

We just #verification# that there are indeed no soldiers in the belly of this trojan *horse*. We're just gonna stab it in the belly with this *awl* to check.

Show on Jisho
2138
駅
station
Anyone living in Japan knows that train stations play little melodies when the train is about to arrive. In Ye Olden Days, when *horses* and carriages were used for transport, the carriage driver would play a little melody on his *shakuhachi* to let the passengers know the carriage was arriving at the next station.
Show on Jisho
2139
騒
boisterous
The hidden Greeks inside the *Trojan Horse* are getting boisterous as one of them is bitten in the *crotch* by a nasty *insect*. If they don't shut up, the Trojans will hear them...
Show on Jisho
2140
駄
burdensome
The Greek warriors inside the *Trojan Horse* are complaining about this burdensome *plump* warrior who is not helping at all (say, just eating candies and watching). - "You know you're such a burden!". Note : be sure to keep "plump" distinct from the primitive meaning of "round" ("fat man").

2143
罵
insult
In ancient Japan, the most grievous insult was to poke a rival's *horse* in the *eye* (consider how rare an expensive a steed was in those days). It was the final step in preparation for a duel to the death.
Show on Jisho
2144
騰
inflation
Inflation is rampant: a *month* ago, I could buy a horse with this money, but now, only a *quarter of a horse*.
Show on Jisho
2145
虎
tiger
Magic wand + first two strokes of pelt (皮) + diced + human legs. A wizard who turns people he doesn't like into newts with his magic wand goes for variety - he has always wanted a tiger pelt - but things go awry when the tiger promptly dices and eats him, leaving only a pair of legs. (a fitting end for a wicked wizard)

2146
虜
captive
Captive *men* are thrown to the *tigers*. Captive women are thrown to the *men*. (thanks, Piitaa) Tip: To avoid confusing keyword *captive* with {1018} note that cap*ti*ve contains "*ti*" for *ti*ger.

skin
Ending up in a tiger's stomach is not good for your skin, as it's full of stomach acids.

虚
void
In Japanese folklore there is no hell, but there is the void. There, a *row* of *tigers* waits in the blackness to devour those souls who have failed in their spiritual life.

戯
frolic
This is a story about the end of the universe. The universe is turning into a featureless *void*. There's nothing we can do about it except for throw a *fiesta* and frolic a little bit before it's all over.

A great Indian #drama# acted out every year is how a poor Bengali boy fended off the *tigers* from his *pigs* using only a *sabre*.
Show on Jisho
2153
虐
tyrannize
The "E" shape actually means claws here, and the real etymology is a tiger tyrannizing other animals with its claws (the etymologies actually make sense once in a blue moon!). I think of the claws here as two hooks, representing the front paws. (stroke order of that part: 二＋last of 直)
Show on Jisho

鹿
deer
*Bambi* wanders into a *cave* and sees a *side order of salad* and *2 spoons*...but what's the main course?
Show on Jisho
2155
麓
foot of a mountain
Many *deer* can be found in the *grove* at the foot of a mountain
Show on Jisho
2156
薦
recommend
It is recommended that deers stick to eating flowers. If they try to eat birds, they may end up choking on them, like this one here. Note that the head (白) is gone and the visible part of the body which is normally written with a stroke of the head must by necessity be drawn with a stroke of the tail.
Show on Jisho
2157
慶
jubilation
*Bambi* was *melancholy* at the death of his mother, but is now in jubilation as he's made friends with thumper.

lovely
Lovely bambi.... pictographe : just take a look at those innocent open eyes (part 1 it's not more far fetched than seeing mediocre in it) with thin eyebrows what a lovely deer ...(part 2)

bear
Bears have the #ability# to smell food cooking on a camp#fire# from over 30ks away (true).
Show on Jisho
2160
能
ability
The amputee has no hands but only stumps of *flesh* beneath his *elbows*. To give him the ability to eat he has *two spoons* implanted in his arm stumps, one in each side.
Show on Jisho
2161
態
attitude
Having a good #attitude# means believing in your *heart* that you have the *ability* to do anything - like memorizing more than 2000 kanji, for example.
Show on Jisho
2162
寅
sign of the tiger
If you draw the sign of the tiger on the ceiling of your house, you will sprout tiger's legs (animal legs) and be able to run and pounce like the big cats yourself.

That was some great #performance#! He caused the *water* to shoot up into the air and form the *sign of the tiger* in airborne droplets. You sure missed a great #performance#!

It is said that earthquakes are caused when Bruce Lee gets rained on, he just hates it and punishes mother earth, punching the ground. The popularity of the legend lead to the kanji meaning anything that quakes.

I love *Bruce Lee* dubbing. His #lips# move, but sometimes words don't come out of his *mouth*.

2170
農
agriculture
The most unlikely persons in the world to take up agriculture must be Bender and Bruce Lee. An awkwared moment as they stare on the various farming utensils, hoe, plow. Both with straw hats on and blue overalls, and drawn in Groenigs irrevent style.

2171
濃
concentrated
History has shown that agriculture usually is concentrated around bodies of water.
Show on Jisho
2172
送
send off
The primitives we really have here are "animal horns (first 3 strokes)" and "big/dog (last 3 strokes)." What are the BIGGEST ANIMAL HORNS that you can think of? For me its a MASTODON. STORY: In caveman times, you SENT OFF packages with the MASTODON express. Primitive: Animal horns + big = Wooly Mammoth. Story:There was a big send off for Wooly mammoth and all his friends waved goodbye as he left down the road.
Show on Jisho
2173
関
connection
see my story for 2016. The CONNECTION between the GATES OF HELL and MASTODONS is that the GATES were made out of MASTODON horns (b/c they so big and old)

Ghosts aren't very intelligent - they have but a *drop* of *brains* - so can't tell the difference between an *elbow* and a pair of *human legs*.

2181
襲
attack
Fuaburisu's story is incredibly good, but I made it a bit simpler: The *imperial dragon* is a rare "*three-headed slingshot-snake*", kept in a *vase* and fed with *meat*. It's very aggressive, so at feeding time you need to wear the special *garment* or it will attack you.
Show on Jisho
2182
嚇
upbraid
To upbraid someone, you criticize them in a menacing way. In other words, you jaw at them with your MOUTH until both sides of their face turn RED (hence the double-red).

2183

majestic plural
(see 2016) In caveman times, the most grand MEAT a king caveman could eat was MASTODON MEAT. The royalty could not get enough, "WE want more MASTO-MEAT!!!"

2184
雰
atmosphere
The part of the sky that is responsible for weather and rain is known as the atmosphere. It only occupies part of the sky though.
Show on Jisho
2185
箇
item
You've entered in a chinese shop where apparently the only item in sale is old, dusty, *hardened bamboo* (for construction for example). It looks like these items have been there forever. Asking the clerk if anything else is available, he doesn't understand and instead asks - "Two items? Three items?" (the kanji is a counter for items) - thinking you want to buy something.

2191
藻
seaweed
Let *wood*en *goods* = *furniture*. Then: Walking along the sea shore you see some washed-up *furniture* with *water* (waves) splashing against it. From a distance it looks like *flowers* are growing out the top, but as you get closer you see it is in fact seaweed.

slave
The samurai from {1097} maintains his good mood on his wedding day. He tells his #slave# that he can keep all *rice* (used for confetti) that he *rakes* up after the ceremony. Generous Man!!

2195
潟
lagoon
Right part: *mortar* *bound up* over *oven fire*, comprising *boiling cauldron*. #Lagoon# is a shallow pond, thus easily warmed by sun, large-scale equivalent of a *boiling cauldron*.
Show on Jisho
2196
丹
cinnabar
#Rusty# old *boat* with the bottom and top missing.
Show on Jisho
2197
丑
sign of the cow
Pictograph of a stanchion, which includes two vertical posts to restrain cows so they can be milked, with a horizontal stroke showing the number of cows per stanchion: one. A stanchion is a great symbol for the SIGN OF THE COW, since modern, domesticated cows are often stanchioned in barns.
Show on Jisho
2198
羞
humiliate
The *sheep* is #ashamed# of it's sheepish nature, and *dons* the *sign of the cow* as a disguise.
Show on Jisho
2199
卯
sign of the hare
Identical to *egg*, without the "yolks." Both hares and eggs are used for Spring celebrations because they are symbols of fertility.
Show on Jisho
2200
巳
sign of the snake
The 巳nd!!! =D
Show on Jisho
2201
此
this here
I'm not going to use 'this here' as a primitive because it's too vague. But 'stop and sit down', usually tied to a tour guide explaining scenery works for me.//*Stop* and *sit down* to have a look at this here.
Show on Jisho
2202
柴
brushwood
(From mantixen's) I'll *stop* and *sit down* on *this here tree*, which happens to be brushwood. Now I have to *brush wood* off my butt.

whit
Those two tourists from my tour group don't have a whit of common sense. They never *stop and sit down* when the tour guide tells them to!

fort
*Stop and sit down* to listen to the tour guide's story. "These *stones* down there used to be a fort, but the enemy came and tore the place down. It has never been rebuild".

2205
髭
beard
"Please *stop and sit down* to look to the painting up there", the tour guide says. "We don't know exactly who is on the painting, but from the *shape* of the *hair* and the distinctive *beard*, we think they meant to depict President Lincoln."

apple

The *shoeshiner* always starts by cleaning the shoes first with phosphorus. This is a bit risky, though, and he sets himself on *fire* (picture him running around in flames).

2219
犀
rhinoceros
Mr. #Rhinoceros# doesn't see well, so to prevent an unwanted attack, I don't surprise him. I always approach waving a *flag* attached to my *walking stick*. I've drawn a picture of the *I-ching* and an attractive *cow* on the *flag*, so Mr. #Rhinoceros# will stay calm when he sees it.

皐

What's a lunar month? The amount of time it takes a *white* to read just *ten* pages of the *I Ching*. Reviewing the Kanji notwithstanding.

綴
mend(compose/spell)

籤

I never play the #lottery#. I'd rather be whacked by *bamboo* staffs as I pass down an *assembly line* than do that. Of course, when a buddy wins, I'll go to the *fiesta* and enjoy the special salsa packed with *green onions*, but I will never play the #lottery# myself.

If you suddenly open the barn doors, the rats will scurry away, RUNNING quickly over the HAY scattered across the floor.

厖
immense
Subject to even more cruel experiments in the name of biological science, the *one-human-legged chihuahua* is injected with chemicals that alters his *shape* grotesquely, and makes him as immense as a *cliff* (see how he's tall enough, standing right beneath it, to reach the top?)

#A certain# drunken *mouth* is on the *floor* at the *fiesta* moaning "#Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa#"

2236
也
est (to be)
This is the kanji for the classical form of "is". I think Heisig's keyword "est" is the old english or latin word for "is". The Scorpion this #est#!

2240
曼
mandala
The mandala is a graphic representation of the universe: the *sun* representing the cosmos, the *eye* represents the human observer, and the *crotch* represents animal instincts. (Thanks for original story by Codexus.)

云
quote
Think of manga where what a person says is *quote*d in a *rising cloud*.

而
and then
If you lose your *comb*, there is no point just hoping it will turn up. You must carefully *comb* the whole house looking for it, and then you will find it.

On the great (but doomed) battleship Yamato, there were lots of *people*, but only one comfort *woman*. Hiding, badly, under the *wheat* stored in the kitchen.

A memorial service is something that makes you *think* about a *person* who has died.

2257
侭
as is
You see *person* holding the *exhaust* pipe which has just dropped off their new car, and say, "You should return that and get your money back!". "Trouble is," they reply, "I bought it as is".
Show on Jisho
2258
脩
dried meat
Once again, *Zoro* ventured out into the remote area to visit his *old taskmaster* (see {悠}). However, the *old taskmaster* has become very weak. His *flesh* looks like dried meat and his heart almost stopped (no heart). He stayed a whole *month* to take care about his former teacher.
Show on Jisho
2259
倅
my son
Important note: Instead of the keyword "my son," the keyword "good for nothing son" may be more appropriate. This word is one of the examples of depreciating titles for family members. This word is used to refer to your son when you especially want to lower his status. So, keep that in mind when deciding on a story or when making your own. I won't consider that person to be my son until he actually manages to show he's capable of something and graduates!
Show on Jisho
2260
做
make do(alt)
Note that the meaning of this (rare) kanji is "#make# (something) / #do# (something)", not "get by with". Story: *Zoro* doesn't rely on *happenstance*, he #makes# things #do# what he wants. Edit: In fact three Japanese kanji dictionaries I checked all list 做 as an alternative to 作 {作}, so "#make (alt)#" might be the best keyword. Story: *Zoro* by *happenstance* found an #alt#ernative way to #make# things. (See also bennyb & faneca's notes).
Show on Jisho
2261
冴
sharp
(Note that per Heisig, this doesn't mean 'able to cut'; it means mentally sharp, adept, or 'on your toes'!) During the *Ice* Age, cavemen had to be especially careful around the woolly mammoth, because they were more mentally *sharp* than they looked. If the cavemen weren't careful, they could end up impaled on the mammoths' *tusks*!
Show on Jisho
2262
凋
wilt
If *ice* forms around the *circumference* of a plant, how can it wilt?

2263
凌
pull through
On their *walk* to the Promised Land ({陸}), our brave *rice-seedlings* are faced with an unforeseen obstacle: An *ice* glacier the size of a rain puddle. Will they be able to pull through?

Much more #stately# than that soil podium, this is made of *ice*. You can still see the dude standing behind it in his *top hat*, and he still spouts pretty much nonsense as many *times* as he can, but you have to admit his *showy altar* is quite #stately#.
